iCF9lBC7OdPiMzWDz5eSKA.text: Great experience the food was really good and the crowd was manageable for a Friday. Nice selection of entree's and dessert

x1fReO3OvOvhNPQOU17x7w.text: took awhile to Wright this review I love thus concept I wish it was used around the Vally more sit at the bar order your food they cook it at the bar then serve it to you the price a good very filling I had the gumbo it was very tasty wish it had more shrimp order it to hot orders 10. heat nation CT will get 7 heat wish there bread was better that wasn't very good dry and hard don't soak up the sauce very well will give it anther try

h6LJI3oucMWrC6M_q0_6Gw.text: Great food & great wine .. The staff are friendly, and the service is great too.  I was there on Wednesday's night, the whole casino wasn't crowded at all.. I got seated & served within 15 minutes..  Try their roast pan & pinot grigio wine! This wine got me insane and I went to do a night trip at 12 am .. Went to flagstaff driving on the 87 then 260 .. And got back home on i17 south ...  Anyways, when I woke up next day, I was like ****ing wine!!! Lol

lrvphdZ9Xz8P3YiRo86DnA.text: Simply one of the best Cajun restaurants I've ever been too including New Orleans.  The portions are large and the prices are very fair.  The spice level is perfect for us spicy eaters.  The only down size is the wait. Unfortunately, seating is limited and wait times typically run 30 minutes to sit, but it's worth it!!!

EGAanCZXKDuYzx84EIfcHg.text: I am a big fan of Cajun food and so happy to have found Ocean Trail.  Have not really found a Cajun restaurant around Scottsdale.  We had lunch and enjoyed their lunch menu offerings.  The lunch sizes are smaller than the dinner portions but quite filling.  The meal also included some soft bread and butter.  I had the crawfish etoufee with crab and dirty rice.  They have a spice scale of 1-10.  I requested a "3" which they suggested was equivalent of tobasco sauce.  I thought it had a good kick, but the tables also have a variety of Louisiana spice sauces, which I added to my dish.  I really enjoyed the dish.  My wife ordered the combo gumbo with shrimp, chicken and crab and dirty rice.  It had great flavor and was full of seafood.  The gumbo had great flavor as well.   We shared a caesar salad which was good.  The service was good.  We thought the meal was affordable for the quality of the food ($35 before tip).  The only slight negative is the location of the restaurant.  It is very small and set right off the casino floor.  There are only a few tables and bar-type seating.  There is quite a bit of traffic from individual's walking around the casino as well as the smoke from smoker coming off the casino floor.  In spite of this small negative, I will definitely be back.

WXqCR7tBoj_5yHtfm0hv-g.text: The food, as usual is amazing. Fresh seafood with quality spices. Unfortunately we did not get a chance to enjoy the food again tonight. The service is what kills this place! Again tonight, ignored for over 20 minutes waiting in line. Even when I looked at a server to ask they ignored us and walked away. Seats available at the bar but they weren't seating folks. What a shame, this could be the best place in the casino. We ended up going to the cantina downstairs which served sushi and other great dishes!

bAN_TSQ4nHdbetYiwXMfOQ.text: You really can not beat the gumbo here!! I recommend starting at a "3" for level of hot. They go up to a "14".. I think my face would melt off! And I love spicy foods! The portion is huge and u can most def share with a friend :)

LVXjC7Vn2-3M_M7fviunDw.text: Another incredible eats here.  Try the pan roast combo with white rice.  Thank you Chef Mike! Seafood is ubber delicious!! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Oysters in the 1/2 she&#39;ll.  Half dozen for $10. Yum!  :)

WgySvNC4jB4UeQ-lHMgo9Q.text: Really cool spot, this is located in a casino and it does not take reservations.   When it opens, there is a line that forms and it is first come first serve. If you have flexible on that, the food is amazing, if you are sitting in stool area, they cook in front of you. This is a unique date area and just something fun to do that is outside the norm.

U7ylIqnD7sE-PagZzu381Q.text: Stopped in for lunch celebrate a friends birthday.  Chef Mike prepared the days special for me ... pounded  chicken breast with the combo pan roast on top 7 spice.  Delicious!  Only thing that was missing....the right beverage

T1TWNBz0efgeXe0fUVcq4A.text: Omg....this place rocks!! Chef Tipp is the bomb and there literally isn't anything on the menu that isn't awesome!! Chef Tipp gave me tasters and all of the taste were so incredible that it made my decision harder!! This place is one of a kind!!

w_3tWDSuC46eDJtRCWbS-Q.text: This place has the best seafood and the best chef, her name is Tip.  She is very friendly with the guests.  I highly recommend the Etouffe  or the pan fry.  Combo on both with dirty rice!

tCTVRRSME2eHJk146ZwqDg.text: This is in the top 5 meals I have ever had, maybe even in the top 3. Yes, it was that good! This is a really small restaurant with 5 tables and bar seats. I have had cajun, New Orleans style food once, in New Orleans, about 10 years ago so I really didn't know what to expect since it had been so long and I didn't even remember what I ordered. The server suggested and appetizer and 1 meal for 2 people to split and it was perfect, just enough food. We started with shrimp in a garlic broth. I wanted to pick up the bowl and drink the broth it was so good!. Two pieces of bread soaked in the broth later, and lots of shrimp, our crawfish and crap ettouffee came out. It was so full of flavor and a very large portion. It was packed with plenty of crawfish and crab.   Luckily our server explained the heat ratings to us because he said it was 1-10 and I immediately said we want 6. Well, their 6 is not what I was thinking because he said a 3 is tabasco sauce! We went with 3 on both dishes and it had just the right amount of heat.   This is a really good restaurant and I can't wait to go back. It is worth every penny and the wait.

YVDaqWryt7VR_5xEu7aJXw.text: Been to Ocean Trail about 8 times over the past 8 months or so and have tried something different each visit (ordered raw oysters every visit but enjoyed different variety everytime). The oysters are always fresh, cold and delicious! The jumbo shrimp cocktail is excellent also but I believe the shrimp are slightly smaller now than when I first came here...not sure?  I personally love the gumbo but have tried pan roasts and etouffee all with either lump crab meat or shrimp and found both crab or shrimp to be plentiful and fulfilling along with the mix of all ingredients. As mentioned by most yelper's, choose your heat wisely but have found 7 to be pretty standard and not too spicy but very flavorful. Please note that one of the lady chef's (not sure of her name but slightly smaller build and a little older than the other chef's) definitely prepares the dishes better than the others but for the most part, food has been consistently good.  The corn chowder is also a favorite but haven't tried the clam chowder yet but have heard numerous recommendations from other guests. The warm, toasty bread that accompanies your meal goes perfectly with anything you order, especially the soups and pan roasts.  One of the most outstanding aspects of this place is the camaraderie amongst the guests @ the bar. I've been very fortunate to meet some truly outstanding people everytime while dining here. My neighbors @ the bar shared numerous stories about their lives, both locals and people visiting from other parts of the US or world, as we sat and enjoyed food and drinks together. The bar staff can be a little hit or miss though but have always met expectation. Like every place, some bartenders truly enjoy what they do while others just show up for work.  Even if you don't necessarily want to gamble, you'll definitely come out a winner everytime after dining @ Ocean Trail! Enjoy!

MZ6p3rl_ZNDsTMs7FlPtsA.text: This place is amazing.  The food flat out kills it.  Yes it is small venue, get over it.  Yes you will probably have to wait, it completely worth it.  The staff is awesome and watching Tipp man the flying-saucer looking cooking apparatuses is really fun as well.  They have a unique concept and they have perfected it.  I have been here 12+ times and I have never been disappointed.  I recommend sitting at the bar, the tables do border the casino floor so I wouldn't want to sit there.  It would make for interesting people watching though....

TYZqhv5H8wSTDmC58Ofgzg.text: This is a great little spot to get a descent gumbo. You can have it made as spicy as you need, The seafood is good for AZ & it's a descent price for the serving. My only complaint is its in a small space and can be a little cramped with anymore than 2 people, but still great food. I'll be back soon!

CVr1kWO9jtmWQWjGo6mxgw.text: Most of the food here is very good. Oysters are fresh. I really enjoyed the combo pan roast. The gumbo was also tasty but had okra which I'm not a huge fan of. The clam chowder was too salty, and I wouldn't order it again.  The freshly baked hot bread was a plus and used as a sponge to mop up all the goodness. I found service to be inattentive. We stood around for awhile before without being addressed, ended up just taking a seat (all the tables were empty).  Took a while before being asked about drinks and bread was served to two tables seated after us before I had to ask for any. Our credit card also sat on the table for a while before it was taken back. I'd understand if they were busy, but they were not. The service really hindered our experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

kb_522BPtfMGo6fY9_iRnw.text: A hidden gem that most don't know about. I have been here a handful of times and have never been disappointed. The seafood creole level 4 is my jam Go for lunch for an even better deal!

fwCxOCfp1xj0-KYRITX7CA.text: This place was a total surprise.  It is absolutely delicious.  The food is fresh and made right in front of you.  We went with four people and all ordered different things and all of it was absolutely delicious.  It can be pretty spicy but they let you decide the level of spice which is really nice.   I had the seafood corn chowder and it was amazing.  The jumbo is really good and the pan roasted dish.  The oyster shooters are a fun way to stat the night.    They don't take reservations and there can be a line.  I'd recommend going early around 5:30 or so.  Unfortunately it is in a smokey casino so you'll have to deal with that.

ARD5GnvchXOZXSWiFYL6xw.text: I have walked past this place a bunch of times & never stopped because of the line. My only wish is it that had a bigger footprint in the casino. The shrimp wasn't over cooked & perfect. The bread was fresh & crusty just perfect for it's intended purpose of dipping. Can't wait to try the other menu offerings. Stop by mid day on a Sunday & you won't have to wait in line for a seat. But don't tell anyone else. Let's keep that part just to ourselves :)

eo4JWFV1MGql4wzak-hElg.text: I love this place for the option of how spicy you want your dish, as well as what size and what you want in it. Basically, whatever you want, you can have! Food lovers dream! I've had 3 or 4 dishes here and they've all been really good. Get the dirty rice, you'll thank me.

0DeeRO_auPJMAuUUFe7kug.text: Tipp is really good at what she does and shes extremely friendly. Enjoyed talking with her while eating.

9LYIFq_fbrbjmTa_F5WqBg.text: Ok, only once and a while I rave about things, so pay attention! Tipp is the one you need to eat from BAM! Tipp's food ova here, is the best Cajun foods I have ever eaten. Now you ask, where is my experience, all over Louisiana have I eaten.You will not find Tipp in Louisiana, Talking Stick in AZ that's where you go period!

RzK79nzfdGoZyw7-Qmg4DQ.text: Food is outstanding,  expensive but great. The gumbo is terrific, be care of the spice level, I asked for a "4" and could barely tolerate the heat.  The staff could use a little lesson in manners, and learn to smile, but an excellent meal overall.

Qo0fz5wOG7xGjLc899JoDw.text: I had the chicken gumbo and it was fantastic. The quantity was massive and the service was excellent.  I will totally come back

yNQYHDq7EHHxFCf9Nm8dGg.text: Absolutely amazing place Tipp prepares some of the most amazing dishes we have never been disappointed had the crab cocktail and the seafood Creole at a heat level of 5 perfectly seasoned

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Absolutely amazing had the seafood Creole at a heat level of 5. Tipp was the chef tonight as usual she prepared an amazing dish .

F-gol4sqMpeGIDx8p2AkSg.text: Who would have thought that this gem would be hidden inside the Talking Stick Casino. It was a chilli and rainy evening and my husband was craving crawfish etouffee. I've rarely had Louisiana style cooking so I was ready to go. I was super happy we came here. We ordered a shrimp cocktail to share and the combo etouffee. WOW WOW WOW. It was so spicy and we ordered level 3 spicy. Everything though was super fresh and tasty. We sat belli up and the bar to see them make our dishes with their fresh spices.   Husband was super full and happy and he said this restaurant made our roster. This means we will be coming back a lot sooner for some more yummy goodness.

uyFYK0F2kCC5LE6arv_EMw.text: Spicy stuff :) they'll put Ghost Pepper in your order just asked its delicious and one of the waiter looks like Sir Jorah from GOT.... Pretty cool

sckN6lwj2Q7UBUfNZBdEyw.text: The best Creole and seafood in all of Arizona. You cannot beat the service here, Gilbert and Dom made my wife and I feel so well taken care of and impressed. Thanks guys! Cannot wait to visit again.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Triple chocolate cake
Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Creole Etouffee

scpA2qv8o4Ghv9xlQQmIrw.text: My family and i have been coming to Oceans Trail for better part of 3 years. As seafood restaurants go it is exceptional, as louisiana style goes it is the best in Arizona and rivals the best restaurants in New Orleans. From the moment you are seated by Jaime and Ryan you are transformed.  Sit at the bar if you can and say hello to Tip. You will never have a better meal or experience then having Tip cook for you right before your eyes. And if your daring get your food spiced to a level 10 with a side of "Tip sauce" you will never no what hit you. Throw in CeCe, Eric, Evan and Wu and a better team you will not find. I have been to some of the finest restaurants around and they pale in comparison to food, ambience and customer service. We were here on Monday, tonight Friday and will be back again tomorrow  That's how good Ocean Trail is!!

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Master Mixologist Jaime
Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Clams on beer broth
Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Our chef Tip at work

TzZ4-gXe8DKLAG5sON0IWA.text: This is a small Cajun seafood bar right off the casino main floor in the Talking Stick Resort. It has a nice modern feel and the "kitchen" is right there in the bar with the chef using interesting steam woks to cook food in front of you. We had the Bloody Mary that comes with a Cajun shrimp. So flavorful and spicy. Delicious!  Two of us shared the cold seafood platter for two. It was amazing esp for only $43. It seemed there was a pound of lump crab alone!  The oysters were fresh and flavorful, the prawns were huge and firm, the clams tender and tasty, and the lump crab so meaty and sweet. The mussels were standard but by no means bad. I would go back to the resort just for this platter, if I ever return to Scottsdale. I would also like to try their hot dishes like jambalaya some time, but the seafood platter was so huge we couldn't even finish it!

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The best deal for a seafood platter. There was a mountain of lump crab!

-xp8DBijn2UyJ38uH1jSOA.text: Best Gumbo and Pan Roast in AZ! Tipp always ensures our food is met to our satisfaction! Make sure not to get the level 10 spice! It is fire! Thank you Tipp for the great food throughout the years. Always looking forward to come here  when she is working!

Z6CoHVCwLWnu_-YAwBimmg.text: Ocean Trail treats me right every time. Chef Tipp is friendly and takes the time to interact with customers, all while making delicious meals. The oysters are always fresh, and my preferred dish - the Louisiana Gumbo - is always great at whatever spice level I get (usually 5-6). Finally, Sara and Ryan are just the best at making sure each visit is better than the last. Check this place out :)

RZdLM7zXwKpEq00lpruhWw.text: We love this restaurant/bar. If we lived closer we would patronize it more often. This time we had the Pan Roast Combo and Pan Roast Crab. My heat index was 2 which wasn't bad at all. They were pretty generous with all the different types of seafood. My wife loved the Pan Roast Crab. She really enjoyed the flavors. We topped off our meal with Blood Orange Gelato. Well, it's not quite the creamy version of gelato, more like shaved ice. But, it was refreshing. The cook gave my wife a Christmas ornament made from used menus, what a great gift.

GLoPAMcsm9NZzHnscOG0oQ.text: Wow! Hopefully this is not the same old same old start to a review or let's say GREAT LIGHT LUNCH. Eric the Chef was phenomenal! Apparently they chef the Creole style delights right in front of you. From Shell to plate the Mussels were fabulous. Sopping up the juices slammed dunked the experience! COME to Talking Stick Resort in Phoenix to see and taste Chef Eric's fine fare. Stellar Experience!

WLycV1ypFbmgxAaJ0Ykseg.text: My cousin introduced me to this spot. At first I questioned the location since it is stuffed in the back corner of the casino near the 25 cent slot machines.  When I arrived, I was quickly impressed on the amazing cajun/seafood selection, freshness, and service.    We sat at the bar (recommended) and ordered a few plates (beer prawns), etouffee, pan roast (go with combo!), while accompanied by wine and oyster shots.  I know the food was amazing to begin with... and after many drinks, I thought it was food for the gods.    The service was very attentive and friendly.  The spice level: I went with 7 (apparently this has ghost peppers in it, which explains why I drank so much).  You can choose spice level from 1-10, with 1 for newbie spice aficionados and 10 for those who want to roll around on the ground crying afterwards.   I actually went back at a later date since I wanted to reconfirm the quality (plus I only had one glass of wine).  And True enough, the food was as good as I remembered it.  One more star for great service and remembering me from the previous visit.   There's also live entertainment around the corner with a decent lounge/bar, so a nice option to wander over after your meal.  They also have happy hour, so if you get there early, you can also enjoy while preserving your pocketbook.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Combo Etouffee with dirty rice... AMAZING!

h4JZCAmsSh4P3-YsPo8jrA.text: The real deal, combo Pan Roast can't go wrong. No reservations, so you must wait in line to get a table, best thing to do is have a early dinner 430ish, also dinner plates are huge, plenty for two! Cheers! got2tix.com

_eiXArlmBqCYEsUC2z2zww.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants in town! Best gumbo and pan roast but you HAVE to get the shrimp boil! I could drink that broth straight from the bowl! But the real secret is the tip sauce. I don't know if I'm spelling that right but it's the chef's special hot sauce. It should be sold in stores everywhere! I honestly would always have it stocked in my house if I could!

Q-HamP43OYJF93GkcRcYCQ.text: My husband and I had ordered take-out from Ocean Trail, a New Orleans style restaurant, so we could eat in their cigar bar, Shadows Lounge. We both ordered the pan roast and you can select either crayfish, shrimp or crab meat in your roast. I selected a combo of all three and my husband had the crayfish. You also can choose the amount of "heat" you want from a scale of 0-10. I choose 0 while my husband choose 7 and thought he could go higher next time. Since I don't like spicy zero was plenty for this wimp. The pan roast is made in a delicious lobster-citrus broth and it is packed with seafood. it comes with either a dirty rice, our choice, or you can get white rice. The dirty rice with the roast was perfect. It also comes with fresh warm, yeasty, soft rolls to dunk into the wonderful sauce. We noticed that the sanitation is very good the chef kept removing gloves as he touched the fish wand while cooking so there was no cross-contamination. The prices are very reasonable too. Will definitely return.

jnlOltDyusMTlhorHXqUxQ.text: Best gumbo in Arizona. I've had gumbo all over but this is one of the best in the west. The gumbo can be customized to your flavor.  The restaurant is small and in the casino but it is worth it.  My recommendation is to go early or on a Sunday because it can get busy and have a major wait. If you are not a gumbo fan don't worry because they have a pan roast that is fabulous, and chowder. Don't forget to try the oyster shooter (oyster, Bloody Mary, vodka in a shot glass).

hYVbE4vK2eEGRxe2_8V-cA.text: The Ocean Trail experience started off a little rocky. The restaurant is in the casino and is not sheltered from all the smoke that comes with a casino floor. That was a huge letdown. When eating you would hope that someone is not blowing a huge cloud of smoke in your face. We ordered the clams and the shrimp boil. The shrimp was pretty solid and spiced to our level of tolerance. The clams were MEH. The waiter after serving us our dish confirmed that the clams were awful.  This really pissed me off. First off, this restaurant was chosen in 2012 for best seafood of the year, and the waiter can't recommend something that dosent suck!?! So, I was ready to leave that place still hungry. My wife however, dosen't leave places hungry, and was ready to try another dish. We decided to split the Seafood Creole. Now, the Creole was unbelievable. My wife and I travel to Nola often and you would be hard pressed to find a better dish. The scallops were perfectly cooked. The spice was a masterpiece and by the end of the dish we were licking the plate. If I were to go to this restaurant again I would make sure to press the waiter for the best seafood at that time. Do not go in there a blindly order something because it sounds good. The resturant will sacrfice quality in order to fullfill the menu.

_JYpggdzX9iFmT79FXOzmw.text: WOWZA!  Went here for Thanksgiving this year and that's the best way to describe this food!!  Their Thanksgiving special included crab legs, lobster tail, shrimp, mussels, rice, and corn on the cob.  One thing was better than the next!  The shrimp were so fresh and tasty.  The crab legs were tender.  The lobster had so much meat inside.  The mussels were even amazing (and I don't normally even like them!).  They were all served in a spicy sauce (you get to choose the spicy level 1-10 for all you wimps). I have had seafood in many different parts of the country and this may be the best plate of seafood I have ever had and at 40 bucks it was a huge steal.   We sat there enjoying our amazing meal while a line snaked around the entire casino for the buffet and all I could think was SUCKAZ!! hahaha  I cannot imagine they had anything better let alone anything worth that wait. The only thing I will warn you about is that this place looks like an airport bar.  It literally looks like they may not even serve food beyond appetizers, but don't be fooled.  That being said it's not the best place for romantic ambiance, but that's okay because you can take the elevator right up to Orange Sky for an after dinner drink (also recommended).

hXUepMGUi-ZCagmBp9ppQQ.text: PDSF Review:  PARKING is free; casino parking lot.  DECOR: restaurant is really small; 50% of the seating at the bar; 50% in high chair/tables.  Line may be get long; so avoid dining rush hours. SERVICE was solid.  FOOD: Corn chowder was salty.  However, when it comes to the seafood pan roast - it was unforgettable.  Every bite had seafood and the seasoning was perfect.  The only caution is the spiciness.  I usually eat very, very spicy, so I thought a Level 9 would be ok... but that pan roast made me sweat and tear up in the eyes... it was too spicy.   I think if I were to go back next time, I would stick to level 7, so that I can actually taste and enjoy the food.  The best pan roast chef if "Tip", a very nice Asian lady.

nZRcnTq7wEeXNsNSiJ8CMQ.text: Ocean Trail is a great find. I had a huge, tasty shrimp cocktail and the BF had oysters and loved them. Service is quick and friendly and if you're waiting in line they invite you to get a drink at the bar. Prices are very reasonable, too.

qSRRZpXV7B15Kxjt432YZg.text: best cajun food in az. if u love hot!!! food. then ask for tip's spicy 10

iirKrrosW9sF4Q0D1kYPoQ.text: This place is off the hook! I have eaten here many times and have loved everything I have tried. Couple of things though: 1. If you come here, expect to wait in line. There are no reservations so come early if you don't want to wait or wait for a long time. 2. This place is not a True "restaurant style" space. It's literally a section off the casino floor that you might think looks good but don't want to wait in line. WAIT IN LINE. Trust me! The gumbo is why I come here. You can order it spice level 0-10 and trust me, it packs a punch!! Portions are huge and extremely satisfying! I love this food so much! To me, there is nothing like this in Arizona (or nothing I know of) and is definitely worth a try. Come here with friends or on a date, it's a great restaurant. Plus, you're already inside Talking Stick so enjoy the casino, music or dance clubs upstairs afterwards. Boom, there's your next fun night out already planned!

Hgl-NbaTqjFAdTpuTPpzqQ.text: If you are looking for a romantic dinner with ambiance, don't go to Ocean Trail.  BUT, if you're looking for one of the best seafood meals in the Valley, definitely plan on dining at Ocean Trail.  Everything is fantastic but the shrimp pan roast is absolutely the best!  I often eat at the restaurant but very frequently get a take out after a day of Blackjack.  The only negative is the small amount of seating....but, if you have to wait, it is definitely worth it.

3HFUtsYnL5eDNbjG3ZwOIw.text: Stopped by Ocean Trails restaurant and all I can say is a big WOW! Red Beans and Andouille is the real deal, just like in New Orleans.  I had the Gumbo as well and the chicken melts in your mouth. This is the real deal.

Fa0hoRJXuVYdqqJI6RAtTA.text: My husband and I found this restaurant at the suggestion of a casino worker.  We are from out of town and ate here twice during out 10 day stay.  The food was AMAZING!!  The crab boil was fabulous!  My only complaint is I can't find a recipe for it to recreate at home.  We may have to fly back just to eat there again!

XJKyOjb2GVn3Gb1-Z1s3UQ.text: I went on a Wednesday night  and was able to sit up at the bar area.  I have to concur..all the employees there are super friendly.  The food...wow.  I tried some of the combo gumbo and the combo pan roast.  Both were spice level 8 of 10.  They were perfect.  Full of meat and super tasty.  I'm definitely going back to try the mussels and the clam chowder.  Oh...the chocolate bomb cake was great too.  Can't wait to go back.  I hear on the weekends, there's sometimes a line of over an hour.

7XZrAk8gRY73bTB5x4ZlTg.text: Love, love , love this place. It is a "hidden gem" among the locals for sure. I think that it is  definitely one of the best places for seafood in the Vally and most definitely one of the best priced! The gumbo is fantastic as are most of the other dishes you can order. I love the seating and the atmosphere. But the real show is the chef that cooks the meal with the steamers behind the circular counter. What a treat to see how it skilled they are. The service is tops too!

rYGUpXo3_9eoCm71r9yvrw.text: I've been to Ocean Trail 3-4 times and think I have a good feel for the place.  I am also a seafood and cajun food fanatic.   Disclaimer: It must first be said that this restaurant is essentially a nice bar at the edge of the main casino floor--it is not a sit-down, fine dining type of place. Though the design is interesting, the atmosphere is good it won't blow you away, and you should avoid sitting nearer to the casino as the occasional smoking gambler passes by and crop dusts your food with their cancer stick. Unappetizing to say the least. Try to get as far away from the casino floor as possible.   OK, now that the disclaimer is done: the food is really, really good, and surprisingly affordable for the quality and quantity that you get.  The specialties are a few types of cajun dishes: gumbo, pan roast, and seafood creole, with your choice of meat (shrimp, crab, oyster, crawfish, chicken)  or a combination of all meats. I've tried each preparation style and they are delicious. Very fresh ingredients prepared right in front of your eyes. The staff will ask you how spicy you want it on a scale of 1 to 10, so you can adjust the heat to your preference.  The other dishes and soups are equally tasty.  They also offer fresh oysters on the half shell, shrimp and crab cocktails, and a shellfish platter of oysters, jumbo shrimp, clams, mussels, and a ton of lump crab meat for only $25.  The seafood cocktails come with the spicient horseradish you've ever had, which is great for those of us who enjoy burn in our sinuses. They also have a full bar with specialty cocktails like oyster-based bloody marys and oyster/vodka shooters. I wouldn't recommend the oyster shooter, though..too much of a good thing.   The service is friendly and efficient, and also quite knowledgeable about the food and its preparation.  You get the feeling that the people who work there genuinely want you to enjoy your experience, which is unfortunately rare. All of this for very reasonable prices...getting fresh shrimp, oysters, etc. anywhere in the valley is usually an expensive proposition, but here $15-$17 gets you generous portions of very good food, and $25 gets you more shellfish than two people can finish.    If I had one complaint, it would be that the shellfish platter is not served with a white wine/butter/parsley accompaniment or even just drawn butter for the mussels. The shrimp and crab are the stars of the show, and the clams and oysters are fresh and tasty, but mussels do not have the same distinctive flavor as the other shellfish; they are a bit bland. It needs some sort of complimentary sauce.  In any event, if that's my biggest complaint after 3-4 visits, then they're doing a good job.  Worth a visit, even if you're not trying your luck at the casino.

sNrqbK7JCZhqT3ZUkYcdsQ.text: The food was great the portions where very large. Between my wife and and we slit a entree. And for 4 drinks a appetizer and an entree came under $50.00.

n8srEXuBRIOr1UVl7eUJdA.text: Trip was our amazing cook letting us sample flavors before we made our choice. This place has some of the freshest most interesting seafood dishes I have ever had. One of the best definitely in Arizona and if a friend didn't refer I probably would have never tried bec ause it doesn't look like anything.

hZHz-Aaj04U_NfoLayENmA.text: We love love love Cajun style seafood. Not too many Cajun places around in Phoenix. The food was simple, yet delicious. We had the shrimp boil and the seafood creole. I ordered mine 10/10 spiciness and it was perfect. It's so awesome to finally find a restaurant that will make food very spicy when you ask them to. The chef was pleasant and very educational. He even shared some recipes with us. Not too much seating though, since it's in the corner of the casino. What a great find! Definitely going back.

KwjBa2PfblIWrdgpnFDawg.text: The BEST gumbo in Phoenix! We have lived in the South and this gumbo is as good as the South has to offer. It's a smaller restaurant setup like a bar with stools surrounding the chefs' who prepare meals fresh in front of you. Each and every bowl of gumbo is prepared to your specifications (ie type of meat, fish, poultry, etc; spicy scale 1-10). They are cooked individually in a pot designed specifically for gumbo. Unfortunately, we have never tried anything else because the gumbo is the star of this restaurant. However, that is probably a good thing.

VgXSwYhJE_-fKgWMQwZ91A.text: Love, Love, Love....just spent 8 days at TSR and ate here 3 times!! Best seafood we have had in a long time and we live near the ocean! Shrimp boil, crab cocktail, fresh oysters are all amazing! Great service and the best chef! Tipp we enjoyed meeting you and you made some amazing dinners for us!! Thank you. We need you to open in the San Francisco Bay Area!!

ebDVk5vw7i-FmNvr_W5rdg.text: I absolutely loved the crawfish etouffee with shrimp.  The flavors and freshness out of sight!!!  Thank goodness I ordered the lunch portion.... More than enough for $10.00.  Will be returning for more!!!

DKhAk5qlDtI-Qm35z-ZRwQ.text: Cajun shrimp bowl was awesome-food is cooked in front of you and is very fresh.

fF1WG-M0wVy9ir48FMfUmA.text: man love the food here ..everything here is excellent always get pan roast or gumbo tried something different this time went with creole superb usually get a level 7 on spicey... this time Tip hooked me up with a 9 ...took sometime to get it down but was simply sensational... love couple places in town this is definite top three places and dishes for me in valley.

VKWhfaCu7NrvG_wq9Xrg7A.text: Tried the Caesar Salad was so very GOOD !  I posted a photo of the long line, and the JUMBO shrimp !

dgLHEl3yso0dpAt_By7Xhg.text: I love this place.  It's a small restaurant inside Talking Stick Casino.  Sit at the bar if you want the full experience.  Watch them fix your Cajun meal right in front of you in the steam pots.  I've been to New Orleans several times and this food stand up with meals I've had along Bourbon St.  The portions are large and flavorful.  They tend to run spicy ... You set the level on a scale of 1-10 when you order.  5 is as much as I can handle.  It's fun to watch if someone orders a 10 while you're there.  Everything I've had there is good including raw oysters, steamed shrimp, gumbo, and jambalaya.  Only thing that could have been better was the collard greens.  The bacon in them made them too salty.

ldS8C-9yH3bH2yZYruhcOw.text: Whenever we are in Scottsdale, (and that's at least 6x a yr because my mom lives there) we typically visit the Talking Stick Resort for a night out of gambling and some of the best cajun/creole food I've ever had...and I've been to NO several times!  I am going to watch Chef Thipp make her awesome shrimp boil next time so I can see what she puts in it.  I order the shrimp boil at a 5/6 spice level my sister orders at a 10...(not sure how that's even possible to enjoy.:)  Have also ordered and thoroughly enjoyed the Corn Chowder which is a meal in itself.  Shrimp Cocktail which are giant prawns that are so perfectly cooked with a majorly robust horseradish side and some lemon...YUM!!!  Great Caesar Salad and all should be washed down with a Bloody that is house made and perfectly spicy without overwhelming with all of the other flavors going on.  Or, very nice wine selection that I've definitely sampled.  The service is always extremely attentive and kind.  Also, being that it's a very small space and we usually eat in the "round" of the bar...they are right there to get you what you need when you need it.  Yes, you might have a wait during peak times but I do not mind waiting for something this consistently delicious.  I never miss a visit when I'm in town! When there...get there!

6ydzg6mqxoBxLW_Sq0Dx-g.text: Ocean Trail is an amazing place to dine out. Everything from the lighting to the food are spectacular!  Please don't get this confused with a sushi resturatunt because it is not a sushi place (nor was it ever supose to be, according to the server, I just think the name throws people off) Anyway I highly suggest people come and give this place a try!

rn_zgOZQZRVzyFq4IHuGfg.text: Tipp, one of the chefs, will make one of the best shrimp boils you'll ever have.  I often order over the 10 scale and it's one of the best spicy dishes I've ever had.  Add some dirty rice on top and you're golden.  Don't forget to get a cup of clam chowder as an appetizer.

4CMkKz1hAMECioI9_My9Ag.text: This place is always amazing.  Talk about consistency.  I eat here at least once a month ever since they opened.  I also drive over 40 minutes just to have lunch or dinner here and it is well worth the drive.  The seafood is always fresh and the staff is so nice.  We brought friends with us last night and they loved it.  Everything except the caesar and soup is fantastic.  The portions are huge so keep that in mind.  If you want seafood in the valley you cant beat this place.  Try the shrimp or the steamed clams for an appetizer and split the pan roast combo for dinner.

WBjIiAiLabKPGV76hEgWCQ.text: This is one of my favorite places to eat! My husband and I always share the shrimp boil appetizer, and etouffee...so delicious! The pan roast is another favorite followed by the gumbo. We even saved room for dessert once and was surprised how good it was too. Wish I could remember what it was called. Definitely recommend this place :)

3v0d4Hy0mX-DKQXGxl6rfg.text: Everything is great.  A 5 is not hot!! Chef Tipp is the best!

brSn4yOqCXqy2lNpxDpDKg.text: We visited the Ocean Trail restaurant while spending New Years at the Talking Stick.  What a great experience!  We sat at the bar surrounding the open kitchen and had a great time talking to the chef as she was preparing the meals right in front of us.  I like my food very spicy and most restaurants can't even come close to making it spicy enough.  The chef took it as a challenge and actually had ghost pepper powder to spice it up for me.  I couldn't be more impressed.  I didn't have to add anything to my gumbo as it was just perfect!  I couldn't recommend this place enough!

cGwIdKibJf1iSRhPgMMn8w.text: I had recently gone here for my boyfriend and my 3 year anniversary. Not exactly romantic with the casino players in the back ground but the food is definitely worth the price and time spent.  The bread is out of this world and so is the gumbo. I cannot wait to try other things on the menu when i decide to go out with friends just for ocean trails. They do not stay open very late weekdays (9pm) but hopefully they stay open later weekends.  Since we only ordered gumbo they give you the option of how spicy you would like it 1-10 5 being moderately spicy(in my opinion it has awesome flavor a little kick not too much heat)(But if you cant do spicy this might be a tad too spicy a 3-4 would be moderate for you but i can do spicier)  I have never tried raw oysters but am willing to try next time and their are definitely cooked oysters in the gumbo along with shrimp and okra from what i remember along with a lot of other things as well along with some amazing dirty rice to mix in with it. So Good!!

oplZJWwRR4QzZHbB5SbcYw.text: (Lyrics - The Beach Boys - Surfer Girl)  Yummy seafood at Ocean Trail Made my belt come all undone Would you serve me would you Ocean Trail Ocean Trail my little Ocean Trail  I have watched you from the floor Standing by the casino's roar Would you serve me would you Ocean Trail Ocean Trail my little Ocean Trail  Ocean Trail is located in the heart of Talking Stick Casino.  Overall, it's crazy lines, smokers passing by, and gamblers galore!  I didn't really care for the openness of this place as patrons of the casino were strolling by.  I didn't wait at all since my family were here waiting for sometimes to get a table for us.  I ordered the Seafood Platter appetizer while my sister and I shared the Pan Roast Crab.  The appetizer came with 4 oysters and shrimps along with several mussels and clams.  Overall, I thought it was pretty good for being in a dessert.  For the price of $39 I guess in a sense it was well priced.  Overall, the freshness is the best it can be for being in a desert.  The Pan Roast Crab was pretty good.  Spicy as it should be but for me it lacked some texture.  If they added some beans or providing some crunch it would have been better.    Ocean Trail is definitely a popular spot in the casino, however if you were to first introduce me to Cajun/Creole food this would have been an atrocity.  Needless to say, there didn't seem to be a trained chef to provide the love.  In the end, if you needed a quick Cajun food fix this place will do just fine. - Enjoy!

U4JAlXNzOiIfsfeAAnh31A.text: Tucked away in a corner of Scottsdale's Talking Stick Resort, across from the Wandering Horse Buffet, lies this out of the way seafood gem... OCEAN TRAIL  My brother and I have made this our annual Thanksgiving dinner destination. We ordered their Thanksgiving Tower of Seafood that includes lobster, crab legs, lump crab meat, jumbo prawns, oysters, scallops,    hot dinner rolls, warm drawn butter, cocktail sauce and a aioli mayo for assorted dipping. A dessert of pumpkin mousse with gingerbread crumbles was phenomenal. They offer a number of Seafood options with a Cajun twist that other patrons were raving about. Ordering seafood in the desert can be risky but Ocean Trail ships in the freshest ocean fare available and it is awesome. The service is attentive from seating to ordering to serving within 15 minutes.   Ocean Trail is the Scottsdale "go to" seafood restaurant for those in the know who crave Cajun and ocean fare that is always fresh and presented by attentive staff.   $$$

We went there around 9pm and had to wait 20-30 minutes to get seated. The portions are huge and even though the food was amazing we couldn't finish it and had to take almost half of our entree to go! Overall, I had a great experience!! The seafood was delicious, the service was great and the prices were normal!! If you are looking for a good seafood, this is the place to go!!

X0Qp3zlPwByNWrdYBvnPuA.text: I had the seafood boil and my date had the gumbo. We shared a red beans and rice for an appetizer. Everything was delicious. Our food came very fast, hot and fresh. The seafood boil broth was amazingly flavored I ate with the bead offered. Staff was friendly and attentive. Funny part is I was visiting a friend who lives there and I suggested to go. They had never been but went on and on how this was going to be a new favorite spot to eat after how amazing the food tasted!

PowIFJYTh5QJC_u5ebHCiQ.text: Had gumbo combo and corn chowder for dinner.  Both are rich and a bit of salty.  One gumbo could serve at least two people.  The gumbo combo has all kind of seafood in it, like shrimp, mussels, crawfish, oysters, etc..  The gumbo taste is alright, but the oysters makes me almost throw up.  The oysters in the gumbo are raw at room temperature in the hot gumbo, makes me feel it is not right, and not a good match.  I would has the oysters fully cooked rather than drop it in the gumbo in raw.  Don't get this wrong, I love to eat fresh raw oysters in half shell, but the oysters in the gumbo tastes like the oysters from the jars, and a bit of fishy.  If you have a good stomach, might go have a try (at risk).  If I go back again (less likely) will not order the one with oyster for sure...  The environment is super noises, everyone is yell out loud to make a conversation, live band with super loud speaker is right next room plus expect to be 2nd hand smoker, very smokey inside the casino.  Plus expect to wait in line for 30-60 minutes, the whole restaurant only has about 30 seats.    I would recommend Baby Kay for gumbo.  Taste better, better environment, and a bit cheaper.

zxih4-RlDxy53EkJsqb3JA.text: This place is amazing. The entire staff always make you feel welcomed and at home when I go. I love the shrimp gumbo I probably would love everything else but I can only order that when I get there! Tip is amazing! I love her cooking!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

pumZTFWC-hUY2N4v_-6rIg.text: First off, the ambience is the casino. Not good.  I knew it was in the casino, but I didn't realize until I saw it that it's practically on the floor with the noisy slots and smokers.  They really should put up some sort of glass partition and circulate fresher air for the patrons.  As it stands, loud, drunk, smoking people in the casino can walk right by your table (within inches) and not be in the restaurant.  Cigarette smoke is not helpful when trying to enjoy a meal.  I have to deduct a star for this.  The buffet is isolated from the casino, they should do something for this spot too.  It's really unfortunate.  The service was friendly and helpful.  A bit inattentive, perhaps, but they were always moving.  Very busy.  So it wasn't neglect.  Now for the food.  We started with the corn seafood chowder.  They warn you that it has a variety of seafood in it (squid, octopus, etc).  Not just clams or shrimps.  But don't let that bother you.  No one flavor stands out, and the seafood is chopped up small enough that you aren't going to get a mouthful of any one thing.  It was really quite tasty, though perhaps just a bit salty.  Then came the shrimp boil.  Basically shrimp boiled in a spicy sauce/broth.  It also was pretty good.  I don't know that I would rave about it as other reviewers have, but I had no problem with it either.  Lastly, the seafood creole.  I got it with the dirty rice.  The dirty rice is very good, but the amount was pretty small for the dish.  I would have doubled it if I were the chef.  The seafood dish itself was actually very similar to the shrimp boil, except there was other stuff besides just shrimp.  It also had scallops, clams, and some other things I wasn't sure about.  It was very good, but didn't really distinguish itself from the shrimp boil much.  The sauce was a bit thicker, but in terms of flavor very similar.  All in all a pretty good meal.  I think I like Pappadeaux's better, but still pretty good.  I'd give them four stars if it wasn't for the noise and smoke.  One nice feature was specifying your spice level on a 1-10 scale.  I liked that.  Another thing to be aware of is this place ain't cheap.

OqVXViLmmr8uSMU2rzhSvQ.text: This is some of the best seafood around. If you like spicy food, ask for Tipp's sauce.  Great flavored, fresh seafood and a great bang for your buck. Have been back almost weekly since we discovered it

ogE37VeyhUfF3FhI82ofKA.text: Tipp is the most amazing chef, she needs a raise!  I eat here every time I come here for multiple meals.  The seafood creole is so amazing if you like seafood!

The raw oysters are nice and big and stacks up to other oysters i've had. Price isn't bad either. My favorite is the crawfish pan roast!! Keep in mind that this place does not have a lot of seating so you might have to wait in line, especially on a busy night!
