2iKBKVJyuK_YtuBxYGEW8A.text: Delicious! This restaurant is tucked inside the casino but it doesn't detract from the experience- you get to people watch as you eat. At least we did...The portions were very large, enough to last for two more meals. Hubby and I ordered Seafood Creole and Crawfish Etouffee. The spice level 1 did the trick- it was a nice kick in the mouth but not to the point where my mouth felt like lava. The seafood was fresh and very very tasty. One thing that threw me off a little was when some of the crab pieces had shell, but I got over it. I would definitely return to this place.

8XJlCXwolQmq1CX66Zft8A.text: Boiled seafood - drinks.  This place is worth the wait (gets busy in the evening) . I've had and loved the Oyster Shooters, Shrimp Pan Roast, slam chowder and that shrimp appetizer is a meal by itself.

wpMN_kOSDZy8IM-3n6iodg.text: Wonderful experience. Excellent food and excellent customer service. Located right around the gaming area- this is a bar/restaurant with distinct seating. Their food was super fresh, excellently spiced, and reasonably priced. Portions were really big.   You can order drinks and chat while they prepare the food. Go for the seafood creole if you like the authentic seafood taste. The server will tell you to pick spiciness from 3-10. I went with a 5 and it would compare to a moderate leaning to spicy for American food.   Enjoy!

3QZ2DJlcUox2RUAQ47XKvQ.text: Great Creole food in the back of a Casino? Not possible I said. I was wrong. VERY wrong.  Fantastic etouffee and the Seafood Pan Roast was awesome. Dip that bread and you'll be in Cajun heaven. Give it a try if you are at Talking Sticks Resort. You will not be disappointed.

yAjIXvhdbZOgWL_cRyKAlQ.text: One of my favorite seafood spots. A hidden jewel. Everything here is super yummy, fresh and huge portions. You can share a dish no problem. I just wish it had more seating space available. The wait could be a long time but well worth it.

2itz7RjRQbV6DLU_hl04Vg.text: Consistently some of the best Cajun seafood in the Phoenix area!  The food is always fresh and flavorful, service has been consistently top notch and there's something I adore about how incongruous it is to have an amazing tiny little Cajun seafood joint in the corner of a casino floor.  The awards Ocean Trails consistently receives are well deserved. And if there is a wait for seating, it is worth it!

lt9FV2qA8Sg0EcuH2d0ijA.text: If you love seafood, then go here. It's by far the best seafood place you'll find. It's limited to your selections, but their menu is just right.  If you go here, you must try their oyster shooter! It's ridiculously good, IMO. I always order their Cajon Jambalaya. It's mouth watering good. Every time I order this dish the next customer would ask what I had ordered. The dish definitely serve 2. Their oysters and shrimp cocktail are good too.  The cooks are great. Heck, generally speaking, the staff are great! There's a lady that works there (you may see her on the weekends, at night) she's been around for a long time. She's good at preparing your orders. Love watching her managing the small space.  Although the spaces are limited, but I think it's just right. Now for the pricing. I know seafood are expensive, but it's worth it here. Good service with good food, I'll pay the extra.   Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. While you wait, have a couple of shots with this beauty: Oyster Shooter.
Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. This is a must have. The magnificent Jambalaya. I had this loaded, not holding back. It will fill you up!
Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. This seafood platter is worth a try. If you can&#39;t decide on what to try, why not try a little of everything.

jB2iLb3y7WWSWJsJs4t7aA.text: I love love love this place. The pan roast is my absolute favorite. The flavor is so delicious. No one can compare to this. I could eat this everyday. Get ready for a wait but it's well worth it! Friendly service and efficiently run for such a small space.

3l4CpLNyaXSdA3rDw16hcw.text: Hands down the best gumbo in the west. I used to rave about the oyster bar at the Palace Station in Las Vegas being best but the way Tipp makes it here at the Ocean trail is the bomb.

Ii7slCIHX_vYspB4pJi85g.text: Thier seafood pan roast is the best. You get your choice of white or brown rice. And crawfish, shrimp and crab or have all three. And change the amount of heat in your dish.

YBF2FuIAX1ibk7Ajkaa1eA.text: Been coming here for years.  Very very good food.  Came in today and I'm not sure if they recently changed suppliers, or not, as the quality of the shrimp seems to be.... different... than it was before?  Not that it was bad, but maybe an 8.5 instead of the usual 10.

vQ1CpKvWV1NQQx51Xh_NiQ.text: Eating at a casino restaurant would normally not be a decision I'd choose, but Ocean Trail was a delightfully delicious surprise! Both the Seafood Corn Chowder and the Shrimp Broil were amazing. When ordering the broil, one has a choice of spiciness from 1-7.  My husband chose 4 and it was right on point. Not too spicy but very flavorful with fresh-tasting shrimp.   The Caesar salad and warm, fresh bread were also very tasty. As far as only giving 4 stars instead of 5, the entrees took a very long time to come out. But, as mentioned above, everything was extremely fresh and piping hot, so I can't really complain. My advice would be to definitely order more (free) bread and get either an appetizer or salad to hold you over.   Another piece of advice would be to eat at an odd time as the line can get quite long- more objective evidence of how delicious the food is! We went around 2:30pm and were seated right away. However, once we left around 5:00pm, there was quite the line waiting to be seated.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Ocean Trail restaurant at Talking Stick Resort &amp; Casino!

Qmv5-8zHXAhe7zp9-TgA-g.text: Tipp Tipp Tipp!  If you know, you know.   Top 5 spot in the valley.   I always go combo gumbo, extra okra, spice level 8, and extra white rice. One of the best dishes in the valley. The wait in the line on Friday and Saturday nights moves pretty quickly, but it's always worth the wait.

-SQI5xUwcPXWp2pYuxC46g.text: I'm a very big fan of this place.  I'm blessed with the fact that it's close to my house!  I've enjoyed pretty much everything on the menu, but always love the Shrimp Gumbo at a spice level of 6. It's a massive bowl and I usually take 1/3 to 1/2 home with me for later. Extremely nice chefs and servers who know how to seriously take care of their customers!  Well worth the price for the quality and serving sizes you receive.  The bread they give you is also absolutely fantastic!  Can't say enough great things about Ocean Trail.  Word to the wise, go during off peak hours as in Mid Afternoon and after 8pm.  It's very small and gets very busy as it's extremely popular and has a huge following!  Love it in large fashion!

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Absolutely Phenomenal Shrimp Gumbo.  You can get it with steamed or dirty rice.  I always order a spice level of 6.

9CrDPWBox-8CKQO9WfRwgw.text: Ocean trail just took me back home, me and my girlfriend are from the south so we were craving Cajun. To our surprise this place had Gunbo on the menu, in ours minds it was no contest, we wanted to be back on bourbon st. LA. The waiter asked for the amount of spice on a scale of 1 to 10 we said five... And chef Tipp delivered! It was hands down the best dish we've had in months!!! She was nice enough to serve the dish herself, not to mention the bread for starters..unbelievably warm and soft We will most definitely be back

b64-HIhVe9ZF-3IvNVp2Bw.text: We ordered the pan roast combo, shrimp cocktail, and clam chowder- YUM. First of all, the shrimp from the cocktail were gigantic; they must be on some serious growth hormones. Second, the clam chowder was the best my boyfriend has had. I personally think there could have been a bit more clam chunks. Lastly, the portion for the pan roast is giant. My boyfriend and I shared one and we were full. The base sort of tastes like a pasta sauce-tomato-y and they certainly do not skimp on their seafood. They ask you for your preference for spice on a scale of 1 to 10 and I asked for 5. I like to think I'm pretty tolerant against heat and I thought the 5 was perfect. I can't imagine getting an 8 (what my next door customer got). Last comment: I really enjoyed watching the staff interacting with each other. They looked like one big family!

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Shrimp cocktail with the master chef in the background making magic
Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pan roast combo

cWlrgHbC2vt3eqElHD_Vyw.text: So good and portions are huge. Always get the shrimp pan roast enough to feed 2 or 3 so value is great.  Would definitely recommend.

S6p3gDLKOXSkJsHqwgfHEQ.text: If you like dinner in cigarettes smoke and half naked teenagers walking on your table  this is the right place. The oyster shot was terrible, include part of oyster shell. The souce on the shot was not on the bottom and the oyster was not really fresh. We get it done.  The combo pan rost... I ordered the spicy grad 3. You can't taste any taste of crab or shrimp. You can't define what you eat, because almost everything is fine shredded except some really small shrimps.  At least it was hot, bread was fresh, nice service.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Oos5nOzzC_4nSmJbkOV9nA.text: I just wanted to leave a quick review here for this place .   I've ate this place a few times actually each time is better than the other times .   Recently had it about a week ago and it was best I ever had it, it was very good and I love seafood crawfish is my all time favorite.   I ordered the Pan Roast with Crawfish and Crab meat, very good taste and rich and creamy as I expected to be every time I visit Arizona this place I always wanna try.    The amount of the Pan Roast is crazy big so much food take it home to-go and eat it for later lol .   Very good place to eat when you're having a seafood craving , hopefully the casino doesn't distract you.   Being that it's located in the Talking Stick casino .   Come and try .

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Crawfish and Crab Pan Roast at Ocean Trail located inside Talking Stick Casino

tgQgxz2aN9rd0h2R1CoBpQ.text: Food is very good but it is literally on the casino floor so 4 stars for food and service but 2 stars for atmosphere. So we won't return.

-zrvPvrian2yStLDUhBOew.text: Oh my my my my my my!!!!! Chef Tipp really knocks it out of the park. We came here to celebrate a friend's promotion and I have to say, I had no idea how delicious this would be. Highly recommend the seafood creole ask for a little taste of Chef's special sauce.

CQGfnPSWKJoH1Rxa_THVBg.text: Not what I expected...  I thought this was gonna be just another one of those "bland casino spots" Fooled me.. Service was great, food was perfect.  Must try: Pan roast combo level 6  The "wait to be seated" time was about 5 mins.. I would've waited 55 more for this food.  Can't wait to try their gumbo

-6FCrrqzlOegqQH5UYNBNg.text: This place is an absolute delight.  It's located inside the talking stick casino. But even if you aren't into gambling I would highly suggest you make the trip. (Parking is free) the restaurant is relatively small but with a cool bar large circular type bar where you can see your food being finished off.  I suggest eating at the bar for the full experience.  My friend is a local regular so helped make some suggestions.  3 of us went and started with a (very) large Caesar salad with lump crab meat on top.  I would consider just going back for the salad, but then the meals came out.  We got 2 to share and could hardly finish them (we are 3 avid eaters mind you) We got a gumbo and a creole style dish with mixed seafood in them.  You can designate your heat (spiciness) from 1-10 and I think there is some crazy level higher than that.  If you're a wuss like me you get a 1 and it's still full of delicious flavor.  Everything from the service and atmosphere and food were outstanding and the highlight of my dining experience in Scottsdale/Phoenix area.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

qd2tdE-MK_5mD-KzJ2yRDQ.text: The service is phenomenal.. the best seafood in Phoenix! Thanks to Tipp and her secret sauce (a.k.a. Tipp's secret sauce) it's worth the wait..

_RJVn0LNTL4zaTepzZEZ2Q.text: I wish I can give more stars. I don't even want to try any other restaurants in the area when I come near here. Very nice people here makes it even more spectacular. Depending on when you go, there may be a wait but definitely worth it. Grab a beer a chit chat. Before you know, you got some delicious food.

OVftyr7bwBnM0WL0KUlpDQ.text: My husband and I love this place. Gamble have a drink and then get ready for amazing food. Small restaurant in the casino and you cant reserve a table but the line isn't bad if you keep an eye on it while your gambling. Our favorite is gumbo 6 heat. Portions are huge so I suggest sharing a dish. YUM

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

NJIv6XvzF1XXrLfYZ2iChw.text: The chef Tipp is awesome!! We have been coming here for five years even after moving from Phoenix. The food is always delicious and keeps us coming back for more. Thank you!!!!

L-mUpzlyH2Y2uHOLgEm7Qw.text: I'm obsessed with their gumbo! It is the only reason I go inside a smoke filled casino. Their oysters and Caesar salad are good as well.

XHSmeP8a6YgHll0X0DnL7Q.text: This place is sooooo good.  It threw me off when I first saw it because it is nothing more than a tiny seafood bar in the middle of a casino.  You are steps away from slot machines.  However, the food is so good it is worth it.  Spicy and full and just delicious.  I have been here several times and always leave satisfied.  If you like cajun food and you love seafood, you owe it to yourself to try this gem of a place!

lkyz0ngWUjhpExblX-_xtA.text: This place is pretty awesome.  Individual gumbo soup dishes made by an Asian lady.  I doubt she is cajun but she makes some good food.  Yeah this place is in the casino but its definitely worth standing in line.

mHzU07i0waN0n5PvWuKWFw.text: Amazing seafood restaurant in a casino. Certainly not your typical casino fare. Very friendly staff who was more than willing to answer questions and make recommendations. The seafood steamed pot was so tasty, and reasonably priced. Will definitely be back when I am in Scottsdale.

bXXh4J-FONU_MnfeG_MYmQ.text: Excellent chicken gumbo.  Crab is great as well.  If you are at talking stick you need to go here.

KHg8LLiSA6yTDyrZoxUO4A.text: Went for lunch after wanting to go here for months and I was impressed.  I got the pan roast combo. It was filled with crab, crawfish, and lots of shrimp. It was almost like a soup but thicker. Seafood in every bite.  I got a 3 on the spicy scale and wish I got about a 5.  The bread is great to dip into the broth.

bDvcQxErjE5Vg7NTOyYG1A.text: Ate here last night, after looking for some highly rated places.  This came up high, so decided to try with colleague.  Good choice overall.  Ordered Pan roast crawfish and Shrimp Gumbo (there were two of us). They explained spice as 1-10, 3 being tabasco.  We got Pan roast as a 3, Gumbo as an 8. 8 was great, but  I needed more.  They brought me the pepper mix to add to it and that did the trick.    I also want to commend the server for saying that if I go an 8 and it was too hot, I couldn't return it (that's why I got the 8, since I had no relative way to gauge their hotness). Here it is easy to add the heat since that is based on the hot pepper flake mix, you can't remove it.  So pay attention to that and ask for the pepper mix, rather than ruin your meal.  I'd give it a 5 based on service and food quality, but the ambiance was why I gave a 4.   I assumed that the restaurant would be off in a corner behind some walls, with some semblance of ambiance, but that wasn't to be.  I don't like the smokers just around the corner, and so that demeaned the experience.  So with that in mind, if you are at the casino and want a great meal, consider it a 5. Food quality great, service great, so do highly recommend it. The only issue i really have is that it is surrounded by people smoking and on the edge of a loud casino situation. The small menu (better word is focused, this is a positive thing here) is fine, and the food was really quite good.    Other reviews saying one dish can serve two are correct, the portions are quite large, so fact that in when looking at prices, really can serve two with one dish depending on appetite of your party.  I did finish my dish myself, but I am a glutton ;-)

Jigv6q0rgi0Pal_Y9MDOmA.text: Love this place. Huge portions, amazing food! I always get the seafood creole and red beans and rice. I have tried other dishes that are pretty good but the creole is just SO good! They let you choose your level of heat 1-10 but, beware the 5 is pretty dang hot anything higher makes the dishes difficult to eat. The seafood all tastes fresh and  the food is so worth the drive & less than romantic ambiance, They need more seats!

Q0-JqVUAFRgqO4Av0vxgVg.text: Had dinner here the other night with friends and I fell in love with this place. Been here twice since then. It's really good and prices are good too.

V6dI_Q9xnCG2gqoElhpkAQ.text: This was one place that I was not surprised to check it out on yelp to see everyone has given it 5 stars! The food is fantastic and the fact that you can pick between 1 and 10 to your specification to its spiciness is also fantastic!! Its all good so I have no specific food to point out!!!

w2HvWkRIFAIPjaWgUacf9g.text: Entertained a cousin visiting from out of town who's a snob about seafood so we decided on Ocean Trail while trying our luck at the tables too. Good food. Their oysters are very fresh and gumbo is one of the better ones I've had.  Our waitress was a bit slow, but she was friendly enough so we weren't too bothered by it. We also had the Crawfish Etouffee which was probably the best of the three ordered. Drinks are decently priced also.

febtNclHyG-v89DVEzbWmA.text: Good food great service, Tip is the best cook

DgNwxsP0yW6HhVzcXs0bsw.text: Yummy creole style dishes. However, I was bummed that they served only the crab meat instead of a few crab legs on the starter platter. Perfect for two, would not bring a crowd because you will never be seated. Can't wait to try more.

jjA0d8egaJZmHNi9HUM5_A.text: I got the gumbo with crab and it was great!   I highly recommend this place as I've had gumbo in LA and this is comparable!

y4UL4bHol9vXPihRNFUJtw.text: Excellent food and great service. Only negative thing is that they recently doubled their prices. But I'll still go back. Get there early so you don't have to wait in line. It is a small restaurant and they were not expecting it to be so busy.

Zalk0TfRigWRYk4lF3uh4g.text: Simple but really great cajun food prepared in steamers right in front of you.  Selections include gumbo, pan roasts (a tomato-based broth with chunks of seafood), or seafood creole all with your choice of shrimp, crab, chicken, crawfish, oysters, or all five, with rice. They also have fresh oysters, jumbo shrimp cocktails, salads, and tasty seafood chowder, as well as the occasional lobster special. I've been probably 20 times and still never had a bad dish. The staff is friendly and helpful, and will adjust the spiciness of the dishes to your taste. By far the best option at the Talking Stick resort.  As another reviewer noted, this restaurant is really just a bar with a couple of tables, stuck right off the casino floor. This is definitely not a fine dining spot, with the clanging of slot machines and dead-eyed gamblers shuffling around fifteen feet away. Still, it's definitely worth a visit to Talking Stick. At $10-12 for lunch portions and $17-19 for huge dinner servings, and $25 for a massive platter of oysters, shrimp, crab, mussels, and clams, it's a fantastic value for the quality and tastiness of the food.  Good, reasonably priced seafood can be hard to come by in the valley, but this spot is a gem.

7MTiPPlXuczTBHJZlwC-Sw.text: Who knew you would find a 4-star diamond in a casino? I'm talking about their chef Tippawan McG at their Cajun seafood bar! Wow, wow, wow! Tip makes a FANTASTIC Cajun Seafood plate, one that you'll be sure to return for more. And she's friendly and down to earth, as are the others that work with tip. You gotta check it out! Guaranteed to satisfy your palate!

H59Sqha7zdIK1zn42hvDcA.text: OMG!!!  This is the perfect way to spend your Friday night...  Start off at the blackjack tables...  Turn your $100 into $600, then color out while you're still up and hit up this spot before they close the kitchen at 11pm. And that's just not the winner's high talking...  I've eaten here twice now and it was delicious both times. First time, I had the seafood pan roast, then this time, the seafood creole. The first is a little creamy, the second was not. Both delicious at a spice level 7 (bring it!  Perfectly spicy but I could still taste the flavors.). Each is big enough to share or pack up for leftovers for the next day. It's so fun to watch Tipp, the head chef, work her ninja magic on all of the hot pots in front of you. If you're nice and talk to her, she'll give you samples of things she's cooking up for other people that you might want to try next time.  Then, finish the evening with listening to the live band at the nearby circular bar.  :-)

E944cHU_66XvZmHPT8fJPA.text: Ah-may-zing.  Oysters? Check.  Bloody marys? Check.  Spiciest shrimp boil ever? Check!!! Depending on the chef, a shrimp boil ordered at level 10/10 on the heat scale truly delivers. I'm a huge chile head; very few dishes deliver that spice I crave. But when I found myself sweating, nose running and mouth ablaze, I knew I was in heaven. The chef told us they use cayenne, habanero and ghost peppers to achieve the level 10. It was nirvana. On top of being spicy, it is actually very flavorful.  Two thumbs up.

xjvz5TcKIvgEpGVarBx1hg.text: Wish this review could be about the actual food here but unfortunately we didn't get to experience any on our visit here Sunday.   After we were seated at one of the seats at a table (not at the bar because they were full), we were just forgotten about.   None of the servers even left the bar/kitchen are during the entire 20 minutes we sat waiting to get served.  Not even a drink order or anything!  It's not like sat ourselves.  Someone definitely told us to take that table so somebody should've known we were there.   After 20 minutes of not even being acknowledged we stood up hoping to get a servers attention and still nothing so we left the place.

gVOpiGucywRXxpnNsbfZoQ.text: Amazing food and service! I recommend arriving early as this place quickly fills up.  Everything on the menu is freshly made and deliciously flavorful! You won't be disappointed with the service either! Great group of servers hands down! No complaints, highly suggest!

1EjsCBgrWcOu1eSbEU37uw.text: This place is RIDIC.  I crave the shrimp boil here like nothing else I have ever craved.  The most amazing flavor. Go hungry because it's a lot of food & you will want to eat every last bite, lick the bowl clean even, it's so good.  If you've never had a seafood boil, it's basically a delicious stew with all sorts of delicious spicy goodness.  OMGawd I want some right now...   Seriously, if you love seafood, this is a MUST try.  If you don't love seafood, get over your non-seafood-loving ways and just go.

60pvEYjvUqzcgOkFSnP1Ag.text: Finding Cajun food in the Phoenix metro area is a challenge for some reason.  Thank goodness for Ocean Trail.  The portions are huge, definitely good for two people.  However we usually order a dish for each person knowing the will be some great left overs.  Most of the seating is at the bar with a few tables for two or four.  Expect to wait to be seated during busy times.   The food is the star at Ocean trail, fresh and delish.  We order 1 on a scale of 1 to 10.  We ordered 3 and 4 before but they were way to hot.  We like ordering 1 and haven't needed to add any heat to them.  Go with 1 and add hot sauce if you need.

E49pydZ02r-EtQZiA-j7cA.text: Great place with a small seating area, but unfortunately the wait was a bit long and worth it. I ordered the pan roasted combo with a level 10 scale on spice. I gotta say my sweat was burning, but loved it and added extra ghost better seasoning. I would go back again.

ICvvzmA2nVH0eOYttyv2Hg.text: This place is awesome! I do not know any other spots in town where you can get  pan roast, gumbo etc. made from scratch in front of you. Everything is fantastic there! Only downside is it is in the casino so sometimes the cigarette smoke can get to you but everything there is great there!

rLOKsd3MDmNdpTbLtWl07Q.text: I love love love Ocean Trail.   My husband and I have eaten there several times and have never been unhappy with the food or service.   Every dish we have tried has been absolutely delicious.  My favorite is the combo pan roast.  I love the spicy citrus flavor with all the amazing seafood in the tomato sauce.  The depth of flavor in each dish is so crazy good,  it is seriously hard not to lick the bowl of every last bit.  We crave Ocean Trail so often,  if we could we would eat there weekly.

cDBGTstHgcQYD1HY0syL9w.text: High quality with reasonable price! The seafood tower is awesome!

oUr0QO-HehhqRSCTDljhCg.text: For all of you who love the Gulf Coast cuisine, the bottom line is that Ocean Trail is the best restaurant in the Valley.  It's the MOST flavorful, the MOST fresh and the MOST friendly environment to enjoy a specially prepared seafood meal.  EVERYTHING is good on the menu!

C2W6WVjNa8rES7bYBANUBQ.text: This is by far the best bang for your buck without sacrificing quality in this Valley when it comes to Oysters and Chowder.  I have eaten at the place on at least 5 seperate occasions. It reminds me of a scaled down version of the wonderful Oyster bars that you might find at some of the Las Vegas Casino's, with the addition of some other tasty seafood boils, and cajun concoctions.  First off, the Oysters on the Half Shell are reasonably priced, as fresh as I have had here in the Valley, and everytime that I have ordered them, they have been consistently fresh. I'm not sure that type of Oysters they serve off the top of my head, but they are great!  As for the Clam and Corn Chowder, they are both amazing for the Valley of the Sun! The clam chowder has a great consistency, and does not have that taste of fishy, canned clams. The flavors of the other ingredients are apparent, and the clams are just a nice tender, mild piece of meat that makes a nice filler for the soup. The Oyster crackers that they garnish the chowder with are actually seasoned, and are very tasty.  The Shrimp boil is another favorite dish. They boil the shrimp in a Citrus, Lobster Stock and finish it with a Tomato Cream sauce. They serve most dishes with crusty sliced bread so you can soak up and enjoy the juices of the dishes.  The only thing that I am not a huge fan of, was the crab salad slider. I'm not going to knock the rating down, as everyone else loved them, and the presentation was great. I think that it just wasn't what I was looking to have at the time.  When you visit, you will most likely have the pleasure of a very nice woman of asian descent cooking your food directly over the bar in front of you. She goes by the name of Tip, which looks as if it's the first three letters of her extremely long first name on her name tag. You will quickly notice that she puts a large amount of love into her food preparation. Chat with her, she is a sweetheart, and deserves compliments on her work. Tip her out on the side if you care to, as the tips are only pooled by the servers at this restaurant.   The manager, Frank deserves a couple of bucks for seating you and taking your order, but in my opinion the one who prepares the meal should get the majority of the reward for the culinary experience that they provide, but that's just my opinion. :)  Frank is an East Coast guy with a stratight face and $500 haircut, but trust me, he does have a sense of humor, give him a hard time..lol  One last thing, and I will cut this short. The specials that they served on Easter and Fathers Day, consisted of a one and a half pound lobster with claws, caesar salad, and red velvet cake for around $30.  If you decide to order the Collard Greens, make sure that Tip is working because she prepares them proper, with bits of swine for flavor, as well as a bit of vinegar. It may not sound so great to the untrained tongue, so I suggest you give them a shot and teach your tongue a lesson.  Cheers! :)

qoCdu8tvGO2y0_DJdWH1-w.text: Small place, mainly a bar with a couple tables open to the casino. The food is great. Tastes like you are sitting in the French Quarter. Jambalaya, great. You pick how spicy you want it. Shrimp cocktail, great. Huge, really tasty, great cocktail sauce. Clam Chowder, great. I've had almost a million (maybe less) chowders and this is among the best. How can I sum up Ocean Trail, great.

O-IPw3Z_zMeTB3PZXx12BQ.text: This restaurant is a gem right off the casino at Talking Stick Resorts. There are only three tables and seats at the bar, but the small space serves great Cajun at whatever spice level you like (3 is Tabasco, 10 is ghost peppers). The crawfish etouffee is served with shrimp, crab or combo. It is the closest to New Orleans I have eaten. I have had the Louisiana Gumbo with crab - outstanding. Add the warm ciabatta rolls, and it doesn't get much better. Visit the Ocean Trail Restaurant at TSR and you won't be disappointed.

GQKV1WJzPkn5Hn2aQ-Nbag.text: Outstanding experience , great jumbo and seafood, wait staff is excellent. Tipp the Chef is amazing, ask her to let you try the sauce she makes. It is AWESOME you better like spicy!!!!  The only negative is the smoking in the casino. Hard to believe this isn't banned yet.

bYrmY0R8o3yI75XCJACKFw.text: It was a little place inside the Casino. Not many seats. There was some confusion on trying to seat us. They started to and said oh you can't sit there please wait back in line. So we waited some more and then we were seated, We both ordered different entrees and well they both looked and tasted about the same. Do not come here if you are looking for a quiet meal or if you would like to hear the other people in your party well. We enjoyed the meal food wise the atmosphere was ok, but we will not be going back.

AodQDljpVqx039aNq7rY-A.text: I like the feel of the place - noisy, but what do you expect along the perimeter of a casino.  Very good service, nice people.  Clam chowder was extremely salty.  Tasty, but a couple swallows of water after every spoonful.  Ah, my blood pressure!  Caesar salad with chicken was good, not great.

zRUba0mjLO5qI8YpM4ClRw.text: I was brainstorming while navigating to the Yelp page for Ocean Trail but as soon as I scanned C G.'s review I stopped since it says exactly everything I was going to say.  I never would have found out about Ocean Trail had it not been for a friend's suggestion.  I'm not a huge fan of Cajun food but this place has amazing Creole.  I ordered a 10 hot and was pleasantly surprised that they actually made it spicy.  I think some places hold back punches when they see a blonde haired white boy order something spicy, but not here.  It is located near the casino floor so that makes for a weird experience if you are just going to eat.  And the beer selection is limited, but the oyster shooters compensate.  Speaking of oysters, you can get 1/2 dozen for $9 which seems like a good deal.  I think the gamblers subsidize the difference with their losses.  I've also heard that the chefs are from the east coast and have some notable seafood certifications (not sure what they are but I can certify they make some mean cajun food chock full of sea critters).

88O-pZe3UOkuZM4piT3GWQ.text: My wife's favorite food is seafood and did this place ever hit the Mark! We had the pan roast and the flavor was absolutely amazing. Best of all, it was my wife's birthday and they gave us a free chocolate cake afterwards!

UtSEidRCxh0X3cAzI7KEJw.text: Maybe because we came at 3:00, changing of the guards, they weren't on there game? The pan roast was good but crawfish frozen.

005H4ivukZDZUqlB0zjnRg.text: LOVE this spot! Tipp is amazing!  Best chef you'll encounter. Get the combo gumbo and you won't be able to stop eating it, even when way past stuffed.

ByA9XETKbT92nVOFl5xhEw.text: We drive out from LUKE AFB for this about once a month!! LOVE IT!!! Chef is awesome! Took my wife for her bday and contacted them early in week and they took care of DESERT! We ALWAYS go right when they open at 11am! NO WAITING!!! Gotta get my fix this week I think!!!

L73ELvt3tZwaysTgcWFFXA.text: The place rocks! Great service! Well executed food truce to the backbone of creole cuisine!

0nZAaHo8MSDtEA7GyMxn6g.text: Look the only reason i am putting 3 stars is not because of the food, because of the wait. There is always a long line to get seated. I get your busy but maybe create a system to have a hostess or waiting list. Have a system where you can text the customer when their table is ready instead of standing for almost an hour. Definitely can add at least 2 more tables. It's just ridiculous. Other than that the food is great.

S-tgiTN9T8NYC88-_7iMvg.text: Food is always delicious. Portions are pretty big. Can't really recommend a particular dish because they are all tasty.

NNwL99mPQb6E09O0uNbdDw.text: This place is legit.  Gumbo was New Orleans quality and oysters were fresh and delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

__L2SUT-dFIFCLvamrz8Qw.text: This is one of the best kitchens in Scottsdale, and try to go in the evening when Tipp is the chef.  The food is authentic Cajun and Creole, and the seafood is amazing.  Everything is perfectly cooked, or chilled, and seasoned, and you can have as much or as little spice if you like on the wonderful seafood Pan Roasts.  The service is excellent and all of the staff are welcoming, attentive, and seemed truly pleased to be able to assist you.  Gilbert was wonderful and Tipp the chef, made time to make polite and gracious conversation.  Amazing food, even if you don't like or are familiar with this type of cuisine, you must go.  They have terrific lunch specials, and its less crowded during the day.  Inside the Talking Stick Casino, but the tastes and flavors are worlds away.  I cannot recommend this restaurant more highly.

lcRo-KVzqg7Eskxh1vX71w.text: I ordered the caesar salad and clam chowder combo for lunch. The salad was good and the clam chowder was very thick. The chowder wss served with oyster crackers already sprinkled on top and my first bite was just a bit salty so i mixed in the crackers. The chowder was not very hot in temperature but I ate most of it.  My husband ordered the Etouffee with dirty rice and it was good. There were small bits of seafood which was not bad. Most of the meal was made at the bar. The Etouffee was very hot in temperature when first served which was really nice. I think it was made at the bar.  The best part of the meal was the bread which was served warm with butter. The service was fine. The restaurant consisted of four tables and a bar off the side of the casino floor. I think my expectations were higher because of the yelp rating. This restaurant was not bad but it was not great either.

cTjxSue_udf8Fb8qQO1PAQ.text: Ocean Trail never disappoints. They have a variety of Cajun style food. You can order gumbo or pan roasts with either white or dirty rice. One dinner meal is enough for two people, the portions are that generous. You can specify the level of spiciness, on a scale of 1-10. I order the shrimp pan roast with a spiciness of 4. That's about medium spice level.   The restaurant is right on the casino floor so it's pretty noisy. There is limited seating, with about 6 tables and about 15 seats around the bar. It gets busy on weekend nights, with long lines forming. Get there early, about 6ish to get seated quickly.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Shrimp Pan Roast

73qekiVdWehKpZj_hHnWQg.text: This place is a MUST visit! The gumbo is above and beyond amazing. The main chef "Tip" is a True craft of her trade.  Sinful greatness. Service was terrific.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken gumbo #5 spicy
Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

F8u4jlpGz8L8_3RRUQpsSA.text: I was very neutral about shrimp cocktails in general, before I came here. The freshness of the shrimp cocktail is a game changer. I will drive across town specifically for it.   I do enjoy the Louisiana Gumbo combo with dirty rice. I've gotten up to 7 spice level and it was still tasty. The dinner portion always leaves leftovers for me.

DwPCs-Xgb2zgvKkas3ER8g.text: I really like Ocean Trail a lot. If you like seafood and a Louisiana vibe and feel of food and in the area it's a go to for me.   I'm rating this 4 stars because of the service. 5 stars for the food and the chefs making it happen. The service is sometimes slow and they don't really care to have much of a conversation with you. It's a burn and turn. They don't quickly fill up drinks (most of the time) and sometimes it takes a while for the bill. No smile when you walk up or anything. I mean this place gets busy l but at least smile or something.   The food. I always get the Pan Roast Combo with dirty rice at a level 6-7 and wow it is awesome. The flavors are spicy, the seafood is prevalent and always a great portion, the dirty rice is perfect to mix and I even add some of the hot sauces they have. I recommend that dish always.   Also if you sit at the bar the chefs I've met are cool and nice to talk to. There is one individual who I'm not a fan of and he I don't think he cares about anyone. Whatever the food is good and a little gambling before or after is also nice. Maybe after so you aren't ticked before you eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pan roast combo all day level 7 today.
Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Too much sauce.
Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Logo game and its pumped today

fFlJw6b6uhbo1bmEQgpZkw.text: Went here for a late dinner with the family. Have been wanting to try out this place so bad. We had about an hour before closing time, but not once that we felt rushed. Our waiter was great and friendly, the food came out pretty quick. We ordered Iced Seafood Platter, Chicken Caesar Salad, Crab Meat Pan Roasts, and Louisiana Gumbo. Everything was great except for the Seafood Platter, it was quite disappointing. The shrimps were not as fresh as I expected especially with the price listed. It was certainly not worth the price. The star was the Louisiana Gumbo, it was simply the best I have ever had and quite honestly why I gave this place the four-star review (aside from great service). I would come back just for the gumbo.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Louisiana Gumbo
Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken Caesar Salad
Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pan Roasts Crab Meat

prrKsrUOZmqP7DlRoxZ-wA.text: Still as good as we remember! Today was my boyfriend's birthday and I told him we could go anywhere he wanted for dinner. Since it's been so long since we last came, he decided on Ocean Trail.   Showed up on a Thursday night around 8:00 at night. Since there are only a few tables and I believe 18 seats around the bar, we were a little worried that we would have to wait in line to get in but there wasn't much of a wait. They had to clean up a spot but there were seats available for us and probably 8 other seats available.   Started our meal with the crab meat cocktail ($20) and it was essentially a martini glass with crab meat with a side of remoulade and cocktail sauce. It was a yummy start since I'm a huge fan of crab.   Brian and I both ordered the pan roast combo (crawfish, crab and shrimp) but he got his without crawfish. I chose the spicy level of 3, which is medium, and he got 6 again. Seriously, I don't know how he enjoyed it so much because I felt like mine was pretty hot for medium. Both of us had dirty rice with our meals and of course, I ordered an extra side of rice - it's the Asian in me     There is also complimentary rolls that we dipped in our meals. This was my cheat meal for the week so one roll for me and the rest for my boyfriend... The both of us took at least half of our meals home too! I know some people don't like reheating seafood but it's so good! Can't let it go to waste and it's honestly still good after reheating it.   I asked if they did anything for birthdays and they brought out a slice of chocolate cake with a candle. It was perfect for my sweet tooth even though it's not my birthday. He doesn't usually care for sweets but he had at least 3 bites - which is a lot for him.   To top off the birthday boy's evening, he won some money in the casino so it was a successful evening!

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Complimentary slice of cake for birthday - he couldn&#39;t wait for the fork so he took a bite while the candle was still lit
Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pan Roast Combo - Shrimo, crab &amp; crawfish
Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Crab meat cocktail and martini in the background

wTepsCvjQZNToxmQ1ohjVw.text: Yumminess all around! Can't go wrong with anything on the menu.. even the warm bread and butter is delicious. I always fill up on the bread and butter, order the clam chowder! And the pan roast with all 3 meats. Mouth watering.

jqRFq_nk1ievBndtYcnTvQ.text: This was an unexpected find for us. We stayed at the Talking Stick with some friends who raved about this place. My husband and I were a bit hesitant as we have never tried this type of cuisine before but we decided to go and give it a shot.   We started with the mussels which were just ok. I've had better honestly. For our main entree I got the pan roast crab meat and the others got shrimp and combos. I was pleasantly surprised at how much I enjoyed the food! Also, the portion sizes are HUGE! You could easily split a meal between two people. We ranged from level 3 to a level 6 in the spice range and even the 3 gave me the sniffles. I like spicy and this was a perfect amount of spice for me. Any higher and I would have been sweating.   The only downside to this restaurant is how small it is.  I believe there are only about 5 tables and then seating around the bar.  They don't take reservations and if it's busy, you have to wait in a line down the hall for people to finish their meals.  Other than that, I highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pan roast crab with dirty rice

kCTxoddNYQvv6GTEp3F3eA.text: This is one of my top ten restaurants in the valley. I bring family & friends here and they all love it. I've tried nearly everything on the menu & I haven't eaten anything I dislike.   Best to avoid the weekends Friday & Saturday nights can have you waiting a while to be sat. It's definitely worth the wait but better to take advantage of going during a slower time for them. Seating is limited & on a first come first serve basis.  Chef Tipp is amazing! I don't think she ever takes a day off. Highly recommended for a wonderful evening out.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

cqxNxLqPo3wTMzmTSR5eGw.text: The best gumbo...this side of Tuscon...very professional atmosphere..clam chowder is amazing..Sevice is good..drinks came quickly..Great little place to take you date...

VN81MtGaELlhulPMxrw_Pw.text: Great lunch! Had a huge shrimp cocktail! The shrimp was soft and succulent. We shared a ceaser salad that was crisp and clean. For my entree we shared was the Pan Roast shrimp with rice. We couldn't finish it!! The staff was wonderful and attentive. It's small cozy and very private. Loved it!

jJL1ES6G5h3yxGL6YSz0YQ.text: Fantastic gumbo and crawfish etouffee. Large shrimp, andouille sausage and ham shavings on the gumbo. Large bowls, come hungry!!

_3lC-8YVqTYikEL1adB1dw.text: The food was absolutely fantastic. Tripp was fun and bubbly. She even gave me advice on other things to do in Scottsdale. I had the combo pan  sear it was amazing !!!! Warning a 7 hot is HOTTTT  I typically love spicy and it had me sweating. Very fun energy!! I highly recommended!!

QwuYxB1CM3DHYGJ-SEMl6w.text: Maybe some of the best seafood in town! Fresh and tasty made right in front of you. Tipp is so skilled and really knows her stuff. Great price too. A+.

Tg157s8ljX2LXe9F1dvbAQ.text: Great shrimp cocktail, shrimp caesar salad, shrimp boil, oyster shooter, and gumbo! Great place to eat while at the casino. Wish the seating area was bigger, long waits to get a seat usually. Get there early!

RcoqobK8LivwgkEE25p-EA.text: Fantastic food, especially inside a casino! The seafood corn chowder is great. The Pan Roasts are really tasty, but careful, they can get really spicy! I'm a sissy so I stick with a 3. A 7 lit me up but I have friends that do a 10. My toilet paper can't get cold enough for me to handle that.....

wKSIw7iz9YUjHP1xkfBy-A.text: I love this place!! The gumbo is awesome and the greens are wonderful!! Great great place!!

-Lw7aHoNSxLC158jg6z7yw.text: This place was awesome! Great food and friendly service. I think this place is even better than Oyster Bar in Vegas. Fresh oysters were super fresh and their pan roast was sooo good! We'll be back very soon.

ovsrhA42gTVGcPGXLUOgqQ.text: The menu is simple, but really good!  We have been looking for decent Cajun food in the valley - well - North of the 101.  This place is great.  You can watch them prepare the food in front of you!  Great pan roast and amazing etouffee.  Be aware - this place is tiny!  I think it seats about 30 people with most of the seating at the bar.  No reservations, so prepare to wait in a line until they are ready for you.  Not a place to bring the kids, but great food in a casino atmosphere!

tWvNV-1XA57fWw_pbhIyNw.text: What a pleasant find.  It's in a corner of the casino, still within view of the floor.  Most of the seating is at an upscale bar where you see the chef preparing your food.  I never would have gone here if I wasn't going to be at the casino for another event, but I'm glad I did.  I ordered the mixed seafood boil, and it was outstanding ($18, and surprisingly, worth every penny).  Just a ton of seafood in a rich sauce that I had to clean up with a ton of their excellent bread.  They ask you to order on a 1-10 scale.  My mother likes a little spice but tried the 3 and said it was almost too hot.  I order a medium to medium hot in a Thai restaurant, and got a 6, and I was sweating and it was at the edge of my comfort zone.  So be forwarned... it's spicy.  My father, however, ordered a 9, and said it was spicy but not as spicy as he wants.  He orders Thai hot usually.    I shared an order of the clams, which were tasty but perhaps a bit expensive at nearly $15.  I saw numerous shrimp cocktails, which looked gigantic and tasty, but didn't see the price or try it.  If not too unreasonable, it looked like 5 gigantic prawns, so a substantial appetizer.  Anyway, I'll be back.  Which is surprising, because I usually hate to step foot in a casino.  But it's just an outstanding, unusual meal.  Give it a try if you love seafood and creole cooking.

mjhx2B4uWJT08qK9KyX1KA.text: Wow! What a fun experience to sit at the bar! We got the seafood corn chowder, crab gumbo, and crawfish pan roast. Everything was delicious! And the lunch portions were just perfect. We can't wait to return!

32LCZgKwctO4wje5UGq_2A.text: This place is amazing! We went with some friends who recommend this place and it did not disappoint! We ordered the shrimp pan roast with extra broth. We ordered it a number 4 spice level and it was perfect!  We also ordered a Caesar salad which was so good!!!  The serving sizes are huge so you can definitely share a plate. The service is also great which is hard to find now a days! We will definitely be back!

edzDeQzMNnRV21UsjEV6iw.text: The oyster is super fresh. Is you are getting the gumbo combo, make sure to eat the oyster first cuz it melt in your mouth. Everything cooked perfectly, what I meant its the seafood was not over cooked.

j-oJxk9r6SOFlYbDacfxfg.text: Wow, well worth the walk through the casino to find this place! The seafood corn chowder was great and the crawfish and crab etouffe was the best I've had outside of Louisiana! The only ding I give the place is the lack of seating: maybe 5 tables or so and then just seating at the bar; however, our wait wasn't bad at 7:15 at night.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Crawfish and crab etouffee

qB0Q_HiYaRXRLZqbFkQO2g.text: Very friendly awesome food. Tipp the chef has the greatest personality and Is friendly. She really is a sweet person who made our night enjoyable. Thank you!! We will always go back for food and for the environment. Cant rant on how good the food is. Love it love it!!!

4sgQkTwo1iXmSkG5x_6UYA.text: I had the crab and crawfish etouffee with dirty rice.  All spice and no flavors in a watery tomato solution.  Too much emphasis was placed on the spice and not on the actual flavor of the etouffee.   Which is surprising because the dish had a generous portion of crawfish (crab, not so much).  The dirty rice was nothing more than a tasteless mass of brown rice with specks of meat.   If you've ever eaten Cajun food from the south  then you will not have the slightest appreciation for cooking here. The jumbo shrimp cocktail was delicious but how can you mess that up?

OBGZwPMXD9RfxhMuA2eumw.text: Hidden gem at the Talking Stick!  This place is awesome!  If you like creole food, and spicy dishes, this place on a corner of the casino is worth the wait that there usually is.  We've been several times, and our favorites are the pan roasts and gumbo.  Just be careful with spice levels...  I generally ask for hotter than the hottest level of spice that most places offer, but the 10 (on a scale of 1-10) is comparable to ghost pepper.  The one time that I made this mistake, the food was still great, but it took me about 1/2 hour to finish it :)  Even if Ocean Trail is a bit out of your way, I highly recommend swinging by TSR, and checking it out.

WqI1-EahqiilaanMOa7lbg.text: I LOVE DINING HERE. Every time I have been here I have not been disappointed. The oysters are consistently huge, fresh, and not sandy. My only request would be that there is an option for chargrilled oysters - though that would mean no more raw oysters for me! The pan roasts are so filling and flavorful too. Between two people, the raw platter with mussels, clams, massive shrimp, oysters, and crab meat AND a single pan roast were more than enough for us to be full and happy.

n5JKMYrITM_j975xpt_ZnQ.text: I loved everything I've tried here. If there's a downside, it's the table and chairs. It's like patio furniture. The food and service never disappoints and that's why we keep going back.

NkJKVcPZt6cNa-wMVay5Jg.text: I would never have expected to write a recommendation for a restaurant at a casino.  The fact that I am tells you all you need to know about Ocean Trail.  It is more of a walk-up eating area than a restaurant; but, don't let that stop you.  This place has the best seafood gumbo this side of New Orleans.  I love it.  I go there at least once a quarter and make excuses to justify going there because I am not a gambler.    There are other really great items on the menu, i.e., the lump crab cocktail and the cajun style shrimp boil, too.  The star attraction is the combo LOUISIANA GUMBO  You can dial in your heat between a 1 (low) and 10( hot).  And order over dirty rice or white rice.  I go with a 7 and dirty rice and with a little fresh warm bread, I am dipping, slurping, and well fed patron. Give it a try.    Afterwards, saunter over to the Shadows Lounge for a post meal cocktail and cigar.  A great evening!!

ZKED7k4XxmyoRZXr8iLmGg.text: This is my new favorite restaurant. This is the perfect date restaurant and the perfect try something new restaurant. While the menu is small, the food is amazing. I have been three times now and tried several thing and they are all better than the previous! My favorite so far is the shrimp boil. The ettouffee is also very good, better than mine! Oysters and shrimp cocktail are also some of the best I have ever had. This is a very small restaurant but worth the wait. I like sitting at the oyster bar and watching them make all the dishes. The red beans and rice are just as good as I had in New Orleans! The only dish I haven't tried is the gumbo and that is up next on the list for me. They let you pick the spiciness of the dishes you order. I get a 4 which is a little hotter than tobasco sauce which is how they explain the levels to you. 3 is tobasco. Service is really good. Prices are very reasonable for seafood and the portions which are huge. I always have some to take home which I just make some rice and have a whole other meal!

V3GD2JSkO7xzwPKQc7aXlw.text: The wait is a little bit long if u have a larger 6+ group. But it is a small place. The food is worth waiting for, we've been back a few times & everything we had was good. The clam chowder.... Soo F'n good.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Soo good

RuLKzyh9RTG8oYh4Am_Gmg.text: I think I'm in love with this place! I started off with the fresh raw oysters; they were beautifully presented on ice with the strongest horseradish ever and cocktail sauce. I must admit the oysters weren't as briny as I like them but they were still good and hella huge. The table bread and butter were a nice touch but the star of the evening was the gumbo and dirty rice! I got the combo with everything at a level five heat and couldn't have been more pleased. It's so fun to watch your pan roast/gumbo get made freshly just for you. Don't forget to order a cocktail too, my hurricane was only $7.50 you can't beat that! Bonus tip: it's surprisingly slow on Sunday afternoons :-)

UF6YBRNyOrfocPQDb468Ew.text: This is not a restaurant. This is a food joint on a casino floor. The food was fair. The service was worse. If you like your food served with an overdose of cigarette smoke, this is the place for you. After enduring two hours of waiting from the time we arrived until our check was settled, we felt disappointed and cheated. I wouldn't refer this place to satan himself.

hpBh4qNC39RYO64ubVArUg.text: Rule 1 - don't eat seafood at a casino.  Exceptions - unless you are at Palace Station in LV or Ocean Trails in Scottsdale!  I have previously reviewed Palace Station so let's focus on Ocean Trail.   Business has forced me to many Native Nation destinations. The rule of thumb is eat elsewhere. OT is a notable exception. It's late. I'm tired and just couldn't make it to Old Town, so I gave OT a try.   Rule 2 - if you can smell the fish, don't eat there!  Neptune in Boston and Blue Point in San Diego are perfect examples of this rule. You walk in and smell the sea, not the fish.   OT is tucked into a small corner of the Talking Stick Resort. Smoking is allowed in the casino. Yes , there is noise. Despite the setting, OT is fresh, clean and spotless without being sterile.   Rule 3 -  the oracle of Cajun, Jeff Cook of Gris Gris in NOLA, taught me "start with the jambalaya or ettouffee. If they don't get it right walk out."  I put the lesson to the test ordering ettouffee and collards.   Mud bugs are fresh - not frozen. The base is a six hour process. Collards are the perfect ratio of wet/fat/mix. The sausage is ordered direct from Baton Rouge.  That sums it up. OT grossly exceeded my expectations. Out of 100 meals 20 get 1 star and a notice to avoid. 65 get no review - I expect really good.  10 get 4 stars. Switch your plans to go there. And five get five stars. These are the unexpected gems that would be missed without the endorsement of some obsessed clown like me.   It's "Ocean Trail"  I guarantee it!!!

zHBkLlMSW3IF6R2BwIgSnA.text: Ocean Trail is one of those weird little gems you discover by accident.  The Creole restaurant sits on the casino floor at Talking Stick Resort in Scottsdale (ok, well technically, it's on the reservation).  Despite its location among the slots, you can carry on a normal conversation (except when somebody hits big) and unless you are extremely sensitive to cigarette smoke, the atmosphere is pleasant.  I've been to OT a few times and while not perfect, you can expect delicious food, efficient service, and a lively experience.  One of the reasons I left off a star was that our dinner last night had a couple of misses.  First, the Blue Point Oysters on the half shell were served with almost no liquor.  Based upon how fast they came out, I suspect they had been shucked some time before they were served.  They weren't awful but they also didn't light us up.  Second, my wife's Cajun Style Shrimp Boil (served in a watery mildly flavored broth) was utterly boring and the shrimp were a bit overcooked.  Not unpalatable but well beneath our previous experiences.  Fortunately, my Seafood Combo Etouffee saved the day.  I ordered it with the dirty rice.  We basically dumped my wife's shrimp into my Etouffee and shoveled the result into our face (I know, bad visual but honest).  You can tell a good etouffee by the color. Bright orange (at least in my book) is a no no.  I love when the base is almost a milk chocolate brown and OT didn't disappoint. They also hit the spice level out of the park at my requested 5 out of ten.  Enough heat to make you blow your nose (yet another lousy visual) but not so much that you lost any of the flavor.  You could taste the complexity of the roux and the seafood stock.  Plus, it was absolutely loaded with seafood (shrimp, crawfish, and crab).  While not perfect last night, I would still highly recommend Ocean Trail.  Go early to avoid the line (no reservations) and then see a show, play some blackjack, or hang out at the nearby bar and dance floor.  You'll have a great time and a fully belly.

NQ285pNZ3iObWh838_Qe1Q.text: Ocean Trail is always fantastic. The only downside is how small the place is, so you have to time your visit to miss the crowd. Great service and excellent food. Shrimp Cocktail, Crab Cocktail, Caesar Salad and Pan Roasts are my favorites.   The Hurricane drink is also quite yummy!

qZ7paVEfp1O3TJN6Asj_Bg.text: I love a casino and even better when it has good food. This my second time at Ocean Trail, but this time the dirty rice was a bit mushy, not pictured. The white rice made up what was lacking in the dirty rice. The gumbo with a choice of 5 level spice was delicious. My coworker had Caesar salad and another companion had the chowder and red beans and rice. I tried the red beans and rice and not quite impressed.  I'm compelled to return, because maybe it was an off day for the dirty rice.  If the service wasn't so good, I would have downgraded the rating.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Gumbo yummy!!

Rjh-fYiSAMjoE3JwcnvX4g.text: Excellent service and a reasonably priced place to eat and enjoy Cajun/New Orleans Style cooking.  The gumbo here was pretty dang good with lots of seafood and spicy flavoring.  They can heat up your  gumbo with pepper from 1-10.  I had an 8 and it was pretty spicy but I still added more Louisiana style garlic pepper sauce to it.  See photo.  Really enjoyed the vibe here and would come again.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Combo Gumbo: Delish!

v6BKSUmTeHV_nvJwdvpABA.text: So yum!! We had the gumbo and creole. Lunchtime and it was a half serving. More then plenty. The rolls were chewy and delicious. There was soooo much delicious seafood in both bowls. They DO NOT skimp on the yum. A little pricey, but when you see how much seafood is in your bowl it all makes sense.

aSvj_JpxBCPc2BzLfHvWJg.text: Came out for my birthday eve dinner.  I chose the pan roast with shrimp and crab, level 5 spice.  He chose the combo gumbo with all the meats, level 7.  He also got the clam chowder and I got the caesar salad.  We both loved our entrees.   We asked the chef what her favorite dish was and she pointed to a pan of seafood creole she was cooking up and let us sample some.  We'll definitely come back for that dish too.  She also let us try her special hot sauce, named after herself (Tipp sauce).  It was a blend of very unique flavors with a really nice kick. She even suggested ways to turn our leftovers into breakfast. Delicious food and fantastic service, easiest 5 stars I've ever given!

opcs3rpYSBUy3q3P0afOVw.text: Anytime I visit Arizona, Ocean Trail is always on my list of restaurants to stop by.   First and foremost, the staff is friendly, warm and inviting. From the second you sit down to the point where you're heading out the door, they're 100% attentive to their customers. We always start out with a random assortment of oysters and they're all scrumptious and fresh!   Let's dig into the good stuff.. the soups! We ordered the Louisiana gumbo and the seafood creole. You've gotta love the fact that their soups are cooked right there in front of you. It really elevates the experience and gives you a great show! They were both very creamy with the perfect amount of spice. My personal favorite was the gumbo because good gumbo is hard to find!  Ocean Trail, I'll be back!

IHVmo4iRRZEcdrUd6NnJPg.text: This restaurant is so cool.  It's a big circle in the center and has many pans to cook ur delicious items right in front of u.  The service was great and the food was amazing.  Probably has the very best clam showdown and delicious rolls.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Crawfish etouffee
Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mmm clam chowder is incredible

fxNzPf9drNHap0rZDTzaGQ.text: Truly an amazing restaurant that I cannot find in the Bay Area.  Every time I come to Scottsdale for business, I come here at least twice.  This definitely deserves a bigger space as it triumphs over the talking stick's other "meh" and "million copies of this" restaurants.  Ocean trail is truly unique.    Ryan has always taken care of me and my experience wouldn't be what it is without his amazing service and friendliness.

H32AFw9IvJWBz-Z8vIkkAA.text: This is definitely a 5 star operation.  I have been smelling the delicious seafood smell throughout the Talking Stick Casino forever but never ventured to try Ocean Trail because I don't like eating alone.  But today I broke the rule.  Hunger ruled.  I ordered just the New England Clam Chowder (small) because I just wanted to try out one item.  Nothing worse than ordering a ton of stuff and finding out that the food sucks.   I was presented with two, warm delicious rolls with butter.  This was good bread.  Many, many places give you something they call bread and it is awful.  This was really nice.   The bowl of soup was small for $8 but I will tell you this:  It had plenty of fresh clams and the taste and texture was amazingly good.  Even the mini oyster  crackers were great tasting and super crunchy.   They have a lunch special during certain hours where you can get soup and salad for about $11.  I am down for that.  Real soon. To the management:  Will you FILL the bowl to the top next time.  I got half a bowl but didn't want to make a fuss on my first visit.  But next time, I will complain.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. New England clam chowder. Super good.
Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Hot bread!  Yum.
Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

IScnFd2BZXRgymx774MebQ.text: Yummy, yum, yum!  This place makes me happy that I do not have seafood allergies.  I came here last night after doing some Yelp research.  I was originally going to try one of the crab in a bag type of places (I've never done this before and I felt like getting a little messy).  After reading reviews that the food tasted frozen I took a hard pass.    Hubby wanted to gamble and I wanted to eat.  Perfect marriage by going to Talking Stick, just like me and my husband.  :)   Everything was super fresh and delicious.  The spice in my husband's gumbo was perfect at a 6.  We shared the mussels to start and they were yummy too.  I had a Cesar salad that seemed to be growing more lettuce babies as I ate it.  It took me forever and I was basically full by the time I got my seafood chowder.  I had a couple of bites of the chowder before I asked to take it to go.   Now, it's early in the morning and Chowder Time!  This is so good!  My only complaint is that I've found tiny pieces of shell or skin from the sea creatures.  I four them last night as well.  I hate having to search my mouth to find this stuff.  Also, my salad was extremely cold. I watched them make a few of them after I got mine and it looks like they throw it into a blast chiller before serving it.  Next time I'm going to ask them to skip that step.  I prefer something closer to room temp for my salads.   I had a glass of prosecco and my husband had a mule made with Hendricks Gin.  We live in Nevada and are aware that the price for a mile with top shelf alcohol there would have been probably double the cost.  My wine was only a little over six dollars.  It was a generous pour too.    The service was great.  The person that took our order was fine. The lady that makes all of the food asked us how we were doing (we sat at the bar).  Another gentleman came by often to check on us and he bagged my food for me.  All-in-all this was a nice experience.

EfgJs6Nd91o_NWG2GjtfeQ.text: This place is just okay to me, I've been here multiple times but I just feel like last time was it for me. The oysters are not bad and the seafood platter is decent. But it's just not that crisp delicious tasting seafood taste that you crave. I ordered the combo pan and the crawfish was the star of the dish. The sauce seemed way thicker than usual and didn't have the fresh taste it usually does. I probably won't return anymore

6RHZfF3SmQDoM5Ca_SbZcg.text: I had a great night here and highly recommend for date night. All of the seafood tasted so fresh. I highly recommend the combo gumbo and the spinach salad with goat cheese. The drinks are strong, take an uber.

ebHV0BBmwN1gj1lPuaxZIA.text: Stopped in to get their fabulous Gumbo and Oysters.  Unfortunately, they changed oysters, and they were about the size of quarters, good tasting but now off my list for place to go.  Ordered my usual Gumbo at #4 hot meter, and got #10.  Just about killed me.  Two wacks in a row, not sure about trying again, used to be fantastic, not sure now.

pWXglpJIZ0IVrwkRioohnQ.text: Hubby and I goggled this place in search of nearby seafood. It's located inside Talking Stick Casino. Boy oh boy did we hit the jackpot!  Everything is good at this place.  The drinks, the service, AND most importantly the food.  When we got there we didn't expect it to be such a small bar area only, style restaurant. There was a line. We were concerned and a guy in line said it's worth the wait.  We waited about 30 minutes to be seated and it was worth every minute.  We had oyster shots which were bomb.  I had the pan roast combo and it was smacking!The food is made fresh and the taste is the best I've had in AZ!  Stacy was our server and she was so kind and took good care of us.  You guys don't know what you're missing out on.  Omg!  So bomb!!! We will be back very soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fresh seafood; creole style .  Delicious!

uhNffkwinU-ICczWM53vIg.text: Wow the hot shrimp bowl was amazing. Had two of them. The Cesar salad was great.  The chef allowed me to taste a few samples and was super nice and sweet. Great food

90c1v-yQ-7mbM8CT3XG6BA.text: Best kept secret for seafood in the Valley. If you like gumbo and some gambling this place is for you.  Small setting and usually a wait to eat at the bar or table. We had no wait and thanks to Talking Stick for the  VIP treatment. I had the crab gumbo and we split the ginormous shrimp cocktail. I'll be back for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bar area
Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Crab gumbo

3pK6BPPCLrKocbZ6mGkNRg.text: The food is incredible.   That's right, ALL of it.  You can do a spice level from 1 to 10 I did 8 and it was very very spicy. I would do seven next time.  The chef Tipp is incredible, every dish I've ever had was spot on!  Can't wait to go back!

oYAemY4ONIQFmI-m6FO2Yw.text: My friends and I came here for a seafood creole dish. I come here about once a month for this particular dish. It is loaded with shrimp, clams, scallops, crab and rice in a creole sauce and is served with fresh, warm rolls. It truly brings back memories of New Orleans. My friends had never been here or tasted such a delightful seafood creole dish in AZ. The casino was packed for New Years day. The noise level was up but not to the level you couldn't talk. The smell of cigarette smoke was in the air but not to the level of burning your eyes and throat as in some other casinos. They did some renovations a couple of months ago. The place was very clean and appeared to be very well managed. If you want to try something different and love seafood, I highly recommend this cafe in the casino. It is worth the trip.

8VfdpKXjICzph8eGMuqRhw.text: We visited Ocean Trails last night before the Roger Clyne and The PeaceMakers concert on a whim and we were pleasantly surprised! I love Cajun Cuisine and this place hit the spot! Not bad for a bar type atmosphere :-) We started off with a Cajun Style Shrimp Boil Appetizer. Very good! Tipp, our Chef of the night was kind enough to provide samples of the different sauces and soups they served since it was our first time. She was awesome and the samples of soups and sauces were awesome. Trying the samples helped in making our decision. We ended up getting 3 dishes among 4 of us and they were very hearty. they gave us an option of heat (spiciness on a rating of 1 to 10) and we opted for 5 on all 3 of our dishes. We selected the Combo Etouffee (with shrimp and crabmeat)  and the sauce was a spicy rich tomato sauce flavor. We also selected the Seafood Creole which had shrimp, clams, scallops and crab with a nice creole sauce. Our final selection was the Louisiana Gumbo and we decided to have crawfish from a selection of Chicken, Crawfish, oyster, shrimp, crabmeat or a combo. We had them serve it up with Dirty Rice from a selection of either Dirty Rice or regular White Rice. It was ALL AWESOME. I would rank it right up there with Pappadeaux's if not better :-)

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Crawfish Etouffee - Yummy!
Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Great Rolls! Reminded me of Pandesal (Filipino Rolls) :-)
Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cajun Style Shrimp Boil for our Appetizer.

KCyMVlowBIqgLaqYlvX6aw.text: I went with expectations. Not usually a good idea, I know. Stood awkwardly in line in the heart of a busy casino for a table. Waited longer to sit at the bar. Promised my hubby this would be worth it. I did everything to put those poor little shrimps and crabs under pressure to perform. Did they? Hell, yeah!  The shrimp and lump crab pan roast will be one of those perfect dishes in the valley for me. The sort you can go back for and know you will stop talking, tuck your phone inside, stop making eye contact with people around you until you dunk the last piece of bread into the delicious lobster broth. Absolute kiss the cook stuff! (and, the adorable hardworking Asian chef only adds to that temptation)

eQofDTOYwGdGOK61y7-kEQ.text: My wife and I saw the reviews so we had to check it out.  Ocean Trail is a must stop any time we are in Phoenix from now on. We were surprised by how small of an area it occupied that we walked by it the first time. We nearly didn't stay until we saw the plates being served. The pan roast combo is the way to go, it was one of the best things we've ever had. Take note that one order was more than enough for the two of us to share, and I'm not a small man.  Although there isn't much seating, they get people through there in short order. It is so worth the wait.

eu95ebRBnveeh_D0R7B72g.text: Didn't live up to ratings. Located in noisy, smoky corner of main casino. Expensive relative to quality. No food specials for happy hour- only house drinks. Some food very good (gumbo), some adequate (Caesar salad), some a bit off (shrimp cocktail not fresh - mushy - sent back). Staff accommodating - tries hard to please.

heZROPziRdjYFFSC81tjSA.text: OH MY NOM. This place is AMAZING. We go to Talking Stick a lot but it wasn't until I read in the Best of Phoenix last year that this was voted "Best Seafood" that we even thought to check it out. I thought that was kind of funny/interesting/odd that the best seafood in Phoenix was in the casino and therefore was very intrigued. The combo gumbo is soooooooooooooo good. Sausage, shrimp, okra, chicken, crawfish, oysters, etc. Get it with dirty rice. One order of this is more than enough for two people to share and still have leftovers. BUT it's so good you may consider getting your own order. We like to order it pretty spicy but you can get it really mild too. Best thing to get to drink with it is a Drifter beer. YUM. Writing this review is making me want to go there right now.   Also, do not go expecting some fancy pants atmosphere. You WILL be 10 feet away from gamblers...and slot machines...you are at a casino.

kquBA0wRHFRO4jtVoKbxbw.text: Absolutely love this place!!! Been coming here for years now!!! Staff is very attentive and very friendly. If you go do your self a favor and sit at the bar. The chef is named Tipp. She makes great food and you get to see her make it right in front of you. You come once and you will be back right away. Great oysters as well!!!

Up2vBZ72Sg_9iAwzmvB-KQ.text: The best creole in town!  Gotta come see Tippa.  She will rock your world. We loved the Creole and the pan roast!

TVXFEZgzw6ZjWuN5XxUnjg.text: It is really close to a 4 star but I can't.  So I was excited about trying it because I go to Vegas about 3-5x a year and go to the Oyster Bar everytime where Bob prepares my food spice level 10.   So my husband and I go and to Ocean Trail the set up I say is more glamorous than my delicious Oyster Bar. We went on a Saturday night so it was a little busy and too many staff members walking around and the waiter was never available when you needed him at the oyster bar there is the cook, server and a cleaner simple.  So it was a bit confusing.   I ordered a hurricane it was too sweet and no liquor.  He ordered a long island just ok.  We ordered half dozen oysters and combination gumbo spicy 8. There was a guy telling me it is too spicy to get a 10. The waiter said this is a lot spicier than the Oyster Bar so I believed them and got the 8.   The oysters were dirty and small. The rolls and butter were delicious.  The gumbo wasnot spspicy at all like eating baby food. So I ordered some ghost pepper "stuff" on the side and you have to sprinkle it to make it hotter with dirty rice. It was an ok date night.  I will go back and try it again.

qwGIGFhlvOcEkQCXcqv1nw.text: Up from the Bay Area. Decided to try this place. I always am hesitant on Casino food specially seafood  But this place is the Bomb. It's not what you think, it's located on the main floor of the casino in kind of a circular kiosk. It seats about 20.  We decided on the steamed mussels and combination gumbo. The mussels was in a wine and garlic broth. The mussels were large and fresh. Drank all the broth. Followed up with the combo gumbo with medium heat. Portions was huge. Easy enough for two people. Great taste. Coming from seafood area I have to admit this was top three stuff. Our Chef Tipp and her staff was great and I will make sure I come back again...like tomorrow.
