Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Gumbo
Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Steamed Mussels

ZcKUjCyLVvKLGgpFN6_UpA.text: I always take out if town foodies here and it never disappoints! Come early (before 6pm) and don't bring too big of a party! Fresh, well prepared seafood, big potions, the bread comes out warm and is good for soaking up the goodness!

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Shrimp boil and crawfish étouffée

GuPnAum3wjFNPCnHKK8z0g.text: Oceans trail, hands down, is a treasure in the desert!  The seafood is extremely fresh and prepared like nothing else in the Southwest. It all starts with Tipp and her amazing staff and passion she brings to this great cuisine. Thank you Tipp for all you do and bring toTalking Stick!. We will see you real soon. Yummo .

XtcsnN2LUbpLwvMgctRSnw.text: Oh my gosh!  This place is a seafood dream come True.  The shrimp cocktails are phenomenal!  And the oysters....oh wow those marvelous little creatures were great.  The gumbo was thick and the etouffee was perfectly spiced.  It's kind of a strange place for a restaurant but we didn't have to wait long.  Plus $.25 machines close by and some good beers and friends make for a complete night.

agVt0lgC7SzF5U5_TiIi-g.text: Spectacular dining experience.  The food is the best in town and Tipp and the staff make you feel very special!!   I would come every night if I could walk past the slot machines without engaging.

BXKOqhY-CqoSHauxFkf4tA.text: I'm struggling to explain how amazingly delicious this place is. I wish it was a full size restaurant because then more people could enjoy this incredibly flavorful food. You can completely personalize your orders and they even give you samples of the various preparations of seafood! I'm just a 135 pound female and I finished my huge plate of shrimp and crab pan roast. No regrets. All happiness.

XJcRyuQQAPCKd175zzleiw.text: Loved the Cajun flavor of the Louisiana gumbo, it was fantastic.  Had to wait about 30 minutes but it was worth it, and at prime time on a Saturday night it's to be expected.  Good drinks, interesting atmosphere being in a small corner of the casino.  Would definitely go again.

N7z5gWf6MffqbsbmPXCPFQ.text: Pretty good Cajun seafood. Small area with mostly counter seating. The restaurant is open to the casino. I would probably eat there again if I happened to be at the casino but I wouldn't make a special trip to go there.

6BVMAiwojssYPGMGY7cVxw.text: Best shrimp gumbo I've ever had. Be cautious, they ask for your level of spice preference. I had a 3 out of 10. I thought it was just right. My husband had a 5. He tolerated it, but thought it was fabulous. Highly recommend this restaurant!!

ERxGu-is96Vb1LArTXdDUg.text: I cannot say enough good things about Ocean Trail. My only complaint is that we didn't discover it sooner! If you like spice and you like seafood, you cannot go wrong here.   When you walk up to Ocean Trial the first time it is almost confusing and a little awkward as it is very small place and on the Casino floor directly behind everyone gambling. If you go on the weekends you will wait standing in a roped off line to the side, but it is worth the interesting atmosphere and the wait.  If you are not sure what to get, I must say that the pan roast is hands down the best dish ever, but the crab cocktail and the shrimp boil are also amazing. You really can't go wrong with anything on the menu. That being said, we did not enjoy the muscles. However, this would be the only thing on the entire menu I wouldn't recommend.  If you haven't been here before - try it! If you been here and weren't sure you fell in love - try the pan roast, and you will!

lGuiXBYc_zJInd28VtLSQw.text: Tip is an amazing chef! She prepares the best gumbo in town! Whether you are here for a quick eat or to sit down with hospitable staff, this is a highly recommended spot for seafood. Definitely will be going here on a monthly basis, if not weekly. Go spicy when trying the gumbo!

VgoPE0fiN-wglKTDrpCFBQ.text: The food and service here are great.  It's small... they have a few tables but it's really more bar-service than a sit down restaurant.  Their take on creole standards are delicious.  I highly recommend the seafood pan roast... Delicious!  The only reason I do not give it 5 stars is because it is open to the casino floor... and you can smoke on the casino floor.  Most of the time it's not a problem but every now and then someone walks by and you can smell the smoke.  Otherwise the place is great.

km1FWcMeSvYEStJsnNalKA.text: The pan roast is one of the best dishes in all of Phoenix.  Whether you order the combo, crawfish, or shrimp, each dish is packed with seafood and satisfies the belly like nothing else.  You still remember that you're eating in a casino, 'cause you really can't drown out the sounds from the slot machines or stop smelling the cigarette smoke wafting your way from all angles, but it doesn't matter, because the food is JUST THAT GOOD.  If you're sitting at one of the small tables away from the bar, it's also hard to ignore the mass of people that are constantly walking by you, since you're right off the casino floor, but don't let that deter you from eating here either.  The food is JUST THAT GOOD!  If you like okra, then you'll love the gumbo, which is also packed with fresh seafood-y goodness and okra-y sliminess.  The shrimp boil is not bad, and would be good on its own, but not when compared to any of the pan roast dishes.  The broth is a little too thin for my taste.  The chowders are excellent, as is the Caesar salad.    But the thing that ties the whole thing together is their bread, which is kind of toasty and soft and chewy all at the same time, and which is perfect for extracting every last bite of sauce and crab bits from the last remnants of your pan roast.  Great bread + great butter + great pan roast = awesome meal every time.  And at only $12 for lunch, or $20 for dinner (for double the portion), I personally think that this meal is a steal.    Sit at the bar and watch the whole cooking process take place, and prepare to be amazed.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Gumbo with combo seafood
Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Combo pan roast - lots and lots of fresh seafood

zllxIDVuMwsKfSr23Mm6Tw.text: One word: Delicious! Quaint area at the casino but worth the wait. Food is incredible and they offer generous portions.

zEy2fJUsAsXorhm0j0XTvw.text: I will keep it simple here - This is the best place to have raw oysters in Phoenix, period.  It's likely that you will be waiting for 20-30 minutes in line even if they are not busy.  If you don't want to wait, go there at 10pm or later.  I have tried so many raw oysters at different restaurants in town, but nothing like ocean trail's.  I am glad they are far away from me, otherwise I would be visiting too often.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. This one is great but the focus is still on oyster.
Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Best oysters in town.

MgSq5rpZSHGI3H9BQsdaPQ.text: Got in for dinner pretty easy considering it was a Saturday night and the casino was packed.  I'm guessing everyone already ate and the rest were getting ready for the night out.  I was greeted quickly and brought a menu and water over.  After seeing some of my neighbors dishes, it was an easy choice for me:  I ordered the combo pan roast.  The server asked me how spicy I wanted the dish....they use a scale of 1-10!!  So that makes it kind of hard to decide...so I just went for a 7.  Chose dirty rice!  Spicy & Dirty!  The dish was huge!  It was loaded with all kinds of goodies...plenty of shrimp to make anyone happy.  BTW...a 7 is not that spicy.  I had to add a little more spice from the sauces they have at the ready.  Along with a nice glass of white wine, this is an almost perfect meal.  Definitely coming back.

5FxtgpnTg5bPO7RbSheHng.text: The oysters were delicious and my boyfriend and I sat there and tried to eat as many as we could but even then we didn't even hit the $175 ticket bill.   The place is crazy small. Picture one bar and 5/7 tables around it. Yeah that small.   The wait staff makes up for it as they were very sweet and pleasant. I was that annoying brat that needed her phone charged. And they took it from me and had one of their cooks charge it. Thus why I have no pictures sorry yelpers!   The clam chowder wasn't as marvelous as Boston or San Francisco but still good consider you are in a land lock state.   All in all try it if you are in the area and if you are their around opening time so you can grab a seat without the wait.

S4X_LP6tOM8CGHo5e4Ml7g.text: Such a hidden gem.  Inside the talking stick casino right off the casino floor a little place that makes amazing Cajun inspired food. My wife and I had date night here and loved it!   Be sure to get the red beans and rice. Really special. From the comments by other yelpers we ordered the pan roasted combo: combo of shrimp crawfish and scallops  so good! And a huge portion,  2 people can share this with a side of red beans and rice. Sit in the back facing the casino floor and it is much quieter and offers a interesting view   the service is super fast and you can watch them preparing the food.  We simply loved it and can't wait to go back!!

xiwvLXN-Nb7SbrlQ6NobZw.text: The food is amazing! And one dish is enough for two people. Fresh and fast! It's a great place to eat all around!

zRmXtyy-xX-4_G3b4EHeXw.text: Still wins every "best" award I have to give in the seafood category for the greater Phoenix area...  BEST oysters BEST pan roasts BEST gumbo BEST steamers BEST shrimp cocktail  Just the best seafood in the desert, period.

thGjm7B2IIRWb_qLh0bdRg.text: Horrible service!!! I have never been spoken to like this! The tall fat guy had the nerve to say that there are people ahead of us and all we could get is drinks! I have been to many upscale restaurants but it really made my decision to never stay here with this type of staff!!! Where is the customer service? He needs retrained! 1st Time here and a bad experience after spending $200 In slots and dealt with this jerk!!'Dont eat here!!! Pricey without the service you deserve. Go to the Coyote Grill!!!!

vxHSS30evKwJ8xf7B2Ohew.text: PAN ROAST!! Get it!    I usually go to Vegas to get the pan roast at the Oyster Bar in Palace Station.   Why else would you go to an old dumpy, off the strip casino like Palace Station?!  The place is tiny with very limited seating and long waits when it gets busy, but it's all worth it.    To my surprise, the Pan roast at Ocean Trail is absolutely comparable to the one in Vegas and now that's one less place I absolutely have to stop by when I go to Vegas!    Pro-Tip:  You love crab?  I mean REALLY love crab?  like a MOUTHFUL of crab?  don't order the freakin combo.  That shrimp and other stuff will break up the crab texture!  Get the CRAB panroast!  enjoy the gobs and gobs of crabby goodness!!  I spent years getting the combo until someone suggested to just get crab.  changed my life!  You get more crab in place of all that other stuff, which is still good and all.... but,,,, CRAB!

SiLtXABt43OaTtiSLA9P0g.text: We just happened to be hungry as we saw this restaurant, so in we went. Our experience was great and made better by our server, can't recall her name but was awesome.  I had the Combo Gumbo, 7 on the spicy level and it was delicious. Wifey had the Chicken Caesar and it was a hit as well. Our friend had the Shrimp ETOUFFEE and loved every bite. Great little place and recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken Caesar
Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Gumbo

gQVsrhwfAgme6H_bQLBtuA.text: I came across this place browsing for cajun places to eat.  I have eaten the famous Oyster Bar at Palace Station in Vegas.  To my surprise, Ocean Trail is actually comparable.  Both times we came our tummies left happy.  Can only eat at the bar if you are 21 and over.  We've had the panroast, clam chowder, oysters, seafood corn chowder.  Clam chowder- this was decent.. but I honestly think most clam chowders taste the same   Oysters- Being a California native I felt this could be fresher but with no bodies of water around Arizona .. this is probably as good as it gets.  The oyster meat was HUGE, big plus.   Seafood corn chowder- I would opt for this over the clam chowder, creamy yet every bite was filled with seafood.  Perfectly seasoned !  Panroast-  I saved the best for last! This was AMAZING.  Perfect taste for those who like tomato based dishes.  I got mine with crawfish and my boyfriend got his with crab.  Both were good, the crawfish was lighter and crab was denser.  The second time we came we got the combination which I liked a lot better.  This is a MUST TRY!  So far the best panroast/seafood I have eaten in Arizona.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lobster pan roast , the daily special

kKdfppPSUYz_975nNsc5kQ.text: This small am restaurant is a hidden gem in this resort. The oysters were wonderful from British Columbia and the gumbo is made to order right in front of you at the bar. Out of this world! Mine had more seafood than I could eat. The bloody Mary's are great too but spicy spicy ! The staff is friendly and attentive. Wish this was in my neighborhood-- I would be a regular !!

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Gumbo pots for made to order gumbo

lRdULkfWW9GUAEQBpvd0AQ.text: Food was exceptional. Large portion size meals.  courteous staff.  Yet, patrons exposed to smokers walking the halls and sitting near gamblers. Did not enjoy our meal celebrating my wife's birthday

LTUkV0qzqbtXJ-4STN5K2g.text: Killer gumbo and oysters!  This place is tucked in the corner at the back of the casino.  Best gumbo this side of the Colorado river, and they oysters are flown in from Vancouver BC.  Even the locals stop here for the simple Cajun menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean Trail - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Individual gumbo pots!

qB1CkBCbmvLlrqDNySaCoA.text: 3/19/11  Had to wait about 30 minutes as it was first come, first served.  Had expected to sit at the counter since there were just the two of us, but our server Jaime actually asked us if we'd prefer sitting at the next available table, which was a four-top, when there was space at the counter to seat two!  Why, of course!  And I thought since we were taking up more space than we needed, I invited a guest we'd been chatting w/ at the line to come join us!  The more, the merrier, right?    We had a great time conversing w/ our new friend (I actually was already acquainted w/ the guest, but  she made for a fun new dinner companion for my friend, too), as she had the 5-shrimp cocktail ($13.95, and the shrimp were almost the size of prawns!) and wine, while the two of us had small bowls of NE clam chowder ($5 each) and bread w/ glasses of wine.  (Pinot grigio and cab for $5.50 each?  Oh yeah!)  Next time, I'm getting a large bowl ($8) of that chowder... so tasty!  Great tip:  You can order your drinks here and take them up to Degree 270 (or anywhere, except out of the casino, for that matter!  Hmm... I wonder if you can take them up to your room??) and chill out up there!

XE5aLZ4FM9DGvYsNY_p8TQ.text: We stayed at the Talking Stick Resort for the first time and really enjoyed it. Inside is Ocean Trail and it was AWESOME! I had  Oyster Shooter which had a large shucked oyster in Vodka and Bloody Mary mix. Then I had the Crawfish Gumbo that is fresh made from scratch right in front of you. You gotta try this place!

jaFD3I-R0hf9gZAkjST5dg.text: OCEAN TRAIL at the Talking Stick Resort was the bomb! I stayed at TSR for four days for business and ended up eating at Ocean Trail twice!  I had the Combo Gumbo on the first visit, and I had the Seafood Creole the second time. Both times I had it with dirty rice and both meals were off the hook!   One thing to remember, their food is fricken HOT!!! They ask you scale of 0-10 how hot you like it. I had the gumbo at 7 and was sweating and my nose was running like a faucet. So the next time I went down to a 5, and it was still bringing the major heat. And I like spice...  I noticed they've been winning awards for their seafood, so it is definitely a hot spot in Scottsdale. Highly recommended!  4.5 stars!!

M_SAOrGaVGhbPu834Tn-RA.text: We adore this place. The chef Tipp is amazing and the service is always spot on. The gumbo and shrimp cocktail are the best I've ever had. Tipp came out to check on everything and brought us a sweet treat.  Thank you TIPP!!!

iX37bv42512CMvbubXgAyg.text: I wasn't as blown away as the other reviewers were. Oysters weren't so fresh, the prep/cooking area is right in the center of the dining area which lets you gander at all the food while it's being made- which I didn't find very appetizing since all the seafood was in these big tubs and gets scooped out unceremoniously, kind of seemed icky. The main courses themselves were good and they'll make it spicy if you ask for it. It's fun and pretty good- I'll likely be back eventually just cause it's in the casino but it's not a place I'm eager to return to.

zarWtnw2cpF327u2B-Neyg.text: Pan roast is the best.  2 people share 1 plate. Extra rice. Pretty much tastes just like the place inside Palace casino in Vegas.

gwD0GepNcRZWjBVz5MELBw.text: I love this place!!!! Oysters were amazing! Clam chowder was amazing!!! Pan roast was even more amazing!! It's a lil tad creamier than oyster bar in Vegas but this was amazing tooo! We always have so much fun there and always have left over!!!

Uh-a5U8qLOLEvkaWc-EUsg.text: This place was amazing. Tipp, the chef, cooked my gumbo perfectly with the right amount of spice. Her cook time with the oysters and shrimp in the gumbo was spot on. Will definitely be back. Be sure to ask for Tipp's secret spice and sauce to kick your dish up a notch!

brlyhu5KMyy1Ckk_TeSQUA.text: This place is incredible and a must try! Only a few items on the menu but they are great! Great seafood! My favorite is the combo gumbo

Hv_c8Cd9ggFzlYDknNIuYQ.text: Tippawan is a master of her craft. I had the best creole I have ever had and I have been around Food my whole life. You got to get the seafood Creole! It was out of this world. Spice levels from 1-10 I love spice and 3 was pretty high!

6abwGwZVe1UPCS8Ksv0Eng.text: We've been coming here for years and have always loved both the food and the service. Chef Tipp and her crew are truly outstanding: friendly, helpful, entertaining, personable...and the food! As good as anything I've had in Nawlins. While we've tried (and thoroughly enjoyed) just about everything on the menu, these days we almost always start with the steamed clams (which we always finish) and then the shrimp gumbo (half of which we end up taking home). And the greens...don't forget Tipp's greens!

j_2yWf2uQS0mrS-BNDeoPg.text: Excellent service from start to finish. Fresh seafood cooked right in front of us at bar was awesome.

lrP7nN2VcuqoqZTAAHiF7A.text: The best Seafood Creole I've had. Their food serving is big enough for sharing. Although the food is good, it's not recommended for families just because it's inside the casino and it's very small unlike other restaurants.

OFpTypZR1lo10GWCUKH8VQ.text: If casinos are all about gambling and the uncertainly that goes along with it, then it's nice to know that you'll be well fed with certainty at Ocean Trail, a small-ish restaurant on the outer bounds of the Talking Stick Casino floor.  Lady luck isn't always generous, but Ocean Trail makes up for it with eye popping portions  A jumbo sized martini glass of lump crab cocktail ($16) is a meal in itself, and relatively fresh (although you'll get a few bits of shell every once in a while).     Gumbo ($13.75 - $19.25) is served in a porcelain swimming pool, topped with a small island of rice (your choice of white or dirty).  Although it's not the best gumbo I've ever tasted, lacking the depth of a good dark roux and absent any notes of file, it's deeply filling, savory and comforting, especially after you've lost your shirt in 3-card poker.    And if you've room after a massive bowl of gumbo, wiped clean with the hot and crusty complimentary rolls, you shouldn't miss the smoky and earthy collard greens ($2.50), spiked with any one of the many hot sauces that are always within reach (Crystals, Tobasco, and Louisiana Hot Sauce among others).  Just as the well seasoned gambler thrives on the thrill and uncertainty of the game the well seasoned gourmand thrives on the comfort and certainty of a good and hearty meal.

waHtp0UAV2b0YsaFct8l5A.text: I've been coming here for 3 years and the food is amazing. I always get the Seafood Creole & shrimp & crab cocktail is really good. Ryan is the best server.. you definitely should come here and try it if u haven't try it that should be on of your bucket list

ilfuNLKZ80hj01zpRYX79A.text: Came here with 3 others on Saturday night and it was about a 15 minute wait. The setting wasn't what I imagined; it's in a corner along the casino, strung off with those fancy VIP ropes.   We ordered oysters, clam chowder, clams in a beer/white wine broth, and some cocktails. The oysters had such a clean taste and my guests raved about the clam chowder. The clams had too much of a beer taste for my liking, but I drink very little - everyone else loved it. Service was great as well.   Would definitely come again.

MpZ9lpYgQTEKxKwy6KCrHQ.text: This is easily, and I mean easily, a 5 star. If you can get here to eat at the bar, you will have spent your meal time wisely. The pan roast here is exactly what it should taste like and you're in phx! What?! If you like it super spicy, go ahead and ask them to crank it up to, but if you just want a tiny dab of spice then ask them to be nice. Not only is the food good, but their staff is friendly as well. Be respectful if they're busy and they'll treat you even better.  A must for those who enjoy pan roast.

ibXJqrCFn3SL4EyxcyDT6Q.text: I had lunch and dinner here throughout the week I was staying at the Talking Stick a week ago.  As I've said before, this is one of the best casual restaurants in Scottsdale.  It's more like a bar, but the FOOD is EXCELLENT!  I always try to get the lunch portion of pan roast seafood at a heat level of 7.  Incredibly spicy and good.  My friend had the gumbo and she said it was the best she's had in a restaurant, compared to hers, and she is a 5-star chef.  Overall, I HIGHLY recommend you try Ocean Trail the next time you're in Scottsdale.  Easy to find and get too.

FvPjZBs2_2H5a0c2kMehbQ.text: Ocean Trail seafood creole plate is the best! Always consistent and always awesome. Choose your own level of spice from 1-10. We go with 6-7...it's fantastic!

JcwDTeZB6vEXUr9STdfD-w.text: The food quality and flavor is a 5, but the service is a 2-3.  This is billed as a cajun seafood restaurant within Talking Stick Casino.  It's really just a tiny little corner of the casino with a bar arrangement and about half a dozen tables around it.  It is really tiny.  So during meal times it takes forever just to get seated, and the services is pretty slow even after that.  On the other hand, the food quality is simply fantastic.  The crab/shrimp cocktails are big and the quality of the product is great.  All of the dinner dishes are generously-sized and very good.  You simply won't leave here hungry, or disappointed in the flavors.  For those who don't like "cajun" style foods, there are plenty of seafood items that are plain and simple.  The crab cocktail, for example, is served with a tasty but mild creamy remoulade.  There are a number of other non-spicy options available.

OiQF2l4Be8kEdXOuR9OsqQ.text: Ocean trail restaurant's shrimp gumbo is the best I've ever had. I'm from Los Angeles, California. Every tme we come to Scottsdale, we make sure to come to ocean's trail restaurant to taste chef Tipp's best cooking (not once but 3-4 ea.   The food is excellent, and the service is the best. Love their food. Sooooo GOOD!  ! ! !

Hb9nFo8XQ_JVABjoNkxPJA.text: Have seen this restaurant many times but never stopped by. Very good crawfish etouffee cooked right in front of you. All of the seafood is very fresh and made to order. I had the lunch Crawfish etouffee with shrimp and crab added. Yum! Will be coming back.
